  36def _frozenset_to_int(s: FrozenSet[int]) -> int:
  37    i = 0
  38    for x in s:
  39        i |= 2**x
  40    return i
  41
  42
  43def _int_to_frozenset(i: int) -> FrozenSet[int]:
  44    s: List[int] = []
  45    x = 0
  46    while i != 0:
  47        if i % 2 == 1:
  48            s.append(x)
  49        i //= 2
  50        x += 1
  51    return frozenset(s)
  52
  53
  54def _int_to_iterator(i: int) -> Iterator[int]:
  55    x = 0
  56    while i != 0:
  57        if i % 2 == 1:
  58            yield x
  59        i //= 2
  60        x += 1

  63class PhaseGadget:
  64    """
  65    Immutable container class for a phase gadget.
  66    """
  67
  68    _qubits: FrozenSet[int]
  69    _basis: Literal["Z", "X"]
  70    _angle: AngleExpr
  71
  72    def __init__(
  73        self, basis: Literal["Z", "X"], angle: AngleExpr, qubits: Collection[int]
  74    ):
  75        if not isinstance(qubits, Collection) or not all(
  76            isinstance(q, int) for q in qubits
  77        ):
  78            raise TypeError(
  79                f"Qubits should be a collection of integers, found {qubits}"
  80            )
  81        if not qubits:
  82            raise ValueError("At least one qubit must be specified.")
  83        if basis not in ("Z", "X"):
  84            raise TypeError("Basis should be 'Z' or 'X'.")
  85        if not isinstance(angle, AngleExpr):
  86            raise TypeError(
  87                f"Angle should be an instance of `AngleExpr`, "
  88                f"found {angle} of type {type(angle)} instead."
  89            )
  90        self._basis = basis
  91        self._angle = angle
  92        self._qubits = frozenset(qubits)
  93
  94    @property
  95    def basis(self) -> Literal["Z", "X"]:
  96        """
  97        Readonly property exposing the basis for this phase gadget.
  98        """
  99        return self._basis
 100
 101    @property
 102    def angle(self) -> AngleExpr:
 103        """
 104        Readonly property exposing the angle for this phase gadget.
 105        """
 106        return self._angle
 107
 108    @property
 109    def qubits(self) -> FrozenSet[int]:
 110        """
 111        Readonly property exposing the qubits spanned by this phase gadget.
 112        """
 113        return self._qubits
 114
 115    def cx_count(
 116        self,
 117        topology: Topology,
 118        *,
 119        mapping: Optional[Union[Sequence[int], Dict[int, int]]] = None,
 120    ) -> int:
 121        """
 122        Returns the CX count for an implementation of this phase gadget
 123        on the given topology based on minimum spanning trees (MST).
 124
 125        The optional `mapping` keyword argument can be used to specify a mapping of
 126        logical (circuit) qubits to phyisical (topology) qubits.
 127        """
 128        if not isinstance(topology, Topology):
 129            raise TypeError(f"Expected Topology, found {type(topology)}.")
 130        if self.angle.is_zero:
 131            return 0
 132        # if self._angle.value % 2 == 0:
 133        #     return 0
 134        if mapping is not None and isinstance(mapping, Sequence):
 135            mapping = {i: mapping[i] for i in range(len(mapping))}
 136        if mapping is not None:
 137            # use the reverse mapping on the topology
 138            topology = topology.mapped_fwd({mapping[i]: i for i in mapping})
 139        return topology.steiner_tree(self._qubits).size()
 140
 141    def on_qiskit_circuit(self, topology: Topology, circuit: Any) -> None:
 142        """
 143        Applies this phase gadget to a given qiskit quantum `circuit`,
 144        using the given `topology` to determine a minimum spanning
 145        tree implementation of the gadget.
 146
 147        This method relies on the `qiskit` library being available.
 148        Specifically, the `circuit` argument must be of type
 149        `qiskit.providers.BaseBackend`.
 150        """
 151        # pylint: disable = too-many-branches, too-many-locals
 152        # TODO: currently uses CX ladder, must change into balanced tree! (same CX count)
 153        try:
 154            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
 155            from qiskit.circuit import QuantumCircuit  # type: ignore
 156        except ModuleNotFoundError as e:
 157            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'qiskit' library.") from e
 158        if not isinstance(circuit, QuantumCircuit):
 159            raise TypeError(
 160                "Argument 'circuit' must be of type " "`qiskit.circuit.QuantumCircuit`."
 161            )
 162        if not isinstance(topology, Topology):
 163            raise TypeError(f"Expected Topology, found {type(topology)}.")
 164        # Build MST data structure:
 165        mst = topology.steiner_tree(self._qubits)
 166        # Pick the root, q0, of the tree
 167        if len(self._qubits) == 1:
 168            q0 = next(iter(self._qubits))
 169        else:
 170            q0 = min(*self._qubits)
 171        try:
 172            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
 173            import networkx as nx
 174        except ModuleNotFoundError as _:
 175            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'networkx' library.")
 176        bitstring = [1 if q in self.qubits else 0 for q in topology.qubits]
 177        # Create the CNOT ladder
 178        upper_ladder: List[Tuple[int, int]] = []
 179        steiner_ladder = []
 180        if mst.size():
 181            if self.basis == "Z":
 182                direction = lambda ctrl, trgt: (ctrl, trgt)
 183            else:
 184                direction = lambda ctrl, trgt: (trgt, ctrl)
 185            for head, tail in reversed(list(nx.bfs_edges(mst, source=q0))):
 186                trgt, ctrl = direction(head, tail)
 187                if bitstring[head] == 0:
 188                    bitstring[head] = (bitstring[ctrl] + bitstring[trgt]) % 2
 189                    steiner_ladder.append((trgt, ctrl))
 190                upper_ladder.append((ctrl, trgt))
 191        cnot_ladder = steiner_ladder + upper_ladder
 192        for ctrl, trgt in cnot_ladder:
 193            circuit.cx(ctrl, trgt)
 194        if self.basis == "Z":
 195            circuit.rz(self.angle.to_qiskit, q0)
 196        else:
 197            circuit.rx(self.angle.to_qiskit, q0)
 198        for ctrl, trgt in reversed(cnot_ladder):
 199            circuit.cx(ctrl, trgt)
 200
 201    def print_impl_info(self, topology: Topology) -> None:
 202        """
 203        Prints information about an implementation of this phase gadget
 204        on the given topology based on minimum spanning trees (MST).
 205        """
 206        if not isinstance(topology, Topology):
 207            raise TypeError(f"Expected Topology, found {type(topology)}.")
 208        mst = topology.steiner_tree(self._qubits)
 209        print(f"MST implementation info for {str(self)}:")
 210        print(f"  - Overall CX count for gadget: {mst.size()}")
 211        print(f"  - MST edges: {mst.edges()}")
 212        print("")
 213
 214    def __str__(self) -> str:
 215        return f"{self.basis}({self.angle}) @ {set(self.qubits)}"
 216
 217    def __repr__(self) -> str:
 218        return f"PhaseGadget({repr(self.basis)}, {self.angle}, {set(self.qubits)})"
 219
 220    def __hash__(self) -> int:
 221        return hash((self.basis, self.angle, self.qubits))
 222
 223    def __eq__(self, other: Any) -> bool:
 224        if self is other:
 225            return True
 226        if not isinstance(other, PhaseGadget):
 227            return NotImplemented
 228        return (
 229            self.basis == other.basis
 230            and self.angle == other.angle
 231            and self.qubits == other.qubits
 232        )

 235class Z:
 236    """
 237    Constructs a Z phase gadget with the idiomatic syntax:
 238
 239    ```py
 240        Z(angle) @ qubits
 241    ```
 242    """
 243
 244    _angle: AngleExpr
 245
 246    def __init__(self, angle: AngleExpr):
 247        if not isinstance(angle, AngleExpr):
 248            raise TypeError(
 249                f"angle should be `AngleExpr`, "
 250                f"found {angle} of type {type(angle)} instead."
 251            )
 252        self._angle = angle
 253
 254    def __matmul__(self, qubits: Collection[int]) -> PhaseGadget:
 255        return PhaseGadget("Z", self._angle, qubits)
 256
 257
 258class X:
 259    """
 260    Constructs an X phase gadget with the idiomatic syntax:
 261
 262    ```py
 263        X(angle) @ qubits
 264    ```
 265    """
 266
 267    _angle: AngleExpr
 268
 269    def __init__(self, angle: AngleExpr):
 270        if not isinstance(angle, AngleExpr):
 271            raise TypeError(
 272                f"angle should be `AngleExpr`, "
 273                f"found {angle} of type {type(angle)} instead."
 274            )
 275        self._angle = angle
 276
 277    def __matmul__(self, qubits: Collection[int]) -> PhaseGadget:
 278        return PhaseGadget("X", self._angle, qubits)
 279
 280
 281def _rx(qubit: int, angle: Angle) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 282    return [X(angle) @ {qubit}]
 283
 284
 285def _rz(qubit: int, angle: Angle) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 286    return [Z(angle) @ {qubit}]
 287
 288
 289def _ry(qubit: int, angle: Angle) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 290    """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Y rotation."""
 291    return _rx(qubit, +pi / 2) + _rz(qubit, angle) + _rx(qubit, -pi / 2)
 292
 293
 294def _i(qubit: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 295    return []
 296
 297
 298def _x(qubit: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 299    return _rx(qubit, pi)
 300
 301
 302def _z(qubit: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 303    """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit X gate."""
 304    return _rz(qubit, pi)
 305
 306
 307def _y(qubit: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 308    """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Y gate."""
 309    return _z(qubit) + _x(qubit)
 310
 311
 312def _s(qubit: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 313    """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit S gate."""
 314    return _rz(qubit, pi / 2)
 315
 316
 317def _sdg(qubit: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 318    """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit S gate."""
 319    return _rz(qubit, -pi / 2)
 320
 321
 322def _v(qubit: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 323    """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit S gate."""
 324    return _rx(qubit, pi / 2)
 325
 326
 327def _vdg(qubit: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 328    """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit S gate."""
 329    return _rx(qubit, -pi / 2)
 330
 331
 332def _t(qubit: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 333    """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit T gate."""
 334    return _rz(qubit, pi / 4)
 335
 336
 337def _h(
 338    qubit: int, basis: Literal["Z", "X"] = "Z", sign: Literal[1, -1] = 1
 339) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 340    """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Hadamard gate."""
 341    if basis not in ("Z", "X"):
 342        raise TypeError(f"Invalid basis {basis}.")
 343    if sign not in (1, -1):
 344        raise TypeError(f"Invalid sign {sign}.")
 345    if basis == "Z":
 346        return (
 347            _rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 348            + _rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 349            + _rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 350        )
 351    return (
 352        _rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 353        + _rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 354        + _rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 355    )
 356
 357
 358def _cu1(ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: Angle) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 359    """Phase gadget implementation of CU1 gate."""
 360    return [Z(-angle) @ {ctrl, tgt}] + _rz(ctrl, angle) + _rz(tgt, angle)
 361
 362
 363def _crz(ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: Angle) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 364    """Phase gadget implementation of CRZ gate."""
 365    return [Z(-angle / 2) @ {ctrl, tgt}] + _rz(tgt, angle / 2)
 366
 367
 368def _cry(ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: Angle) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 369    """Phase gadget implementation of CRY gate."""
 370    return _v(tgt) + _crz(ctrl, tgt, angle) + _vdg(tgt)
 371
 372
 373def _crx(ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: Angle) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 374    """Phase gadget implementation of CRX gate."""
 375    return _h(tgt) + _crz(ctrl, tgt, angle) + _h(tgt, sign=-1)
 376
 377
 378def _cz(leg1: int, leg2: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 379    """Phase gadget implementation of CZ gate."""
 380    return _cu1(leg1, leg2, pi / 2)
 381
 382
 383def _cy(leg1: int, leg2: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 384    """Phase gadget implementation of CY gate."""
 385    return _v(leg2) + _cz(leg1, leg2) + _vdg(leg2)
 386
 387
 388def _cx(ctrl: int, tgt: int) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 389    """Phase gadget implementation of CX gate."""
 390    return _h(tgt) + _cz(ctrl, tgt) + _h(tgt, sign=-1)
 391
 392
 393def _u3(qubit: int, theta: Angle, phi: Angle, lam: Angle) -> List[PhaseGadget]:
 394    """Phase gadget implementation of U3 gate."""
 395    return _rz(qubit, lam) + _ry(qubit, theta) + _rz(qubit, phi)
 396
 397
 398class PhaseCircuit(Sequence[PhaseGadget]):
 399    """
 400    Container class for a circuit of mixed ZX phase gadgets.
 401    """
 402
 403    # pylint: disable = too-many-public-methods
 404
 405    _matrix: Dict[Literal["Z", "X"], npt.NDArray[np.uint8]]
 406    """
 407        For `basis in ("Z", "X")`, the matrix `self._matrix[basis]`
 408        is the binary matrix encoding the qubits spanned by the
 409        `basis` gadgets.
 410    """
 411
 412    _gadget_idxs: Dict[Literal["Z", "X"], List[int]]
 413    """
 414        For `basis in ("Z", "X")`, the list `self._gadget_idxs[basis]`
 415        maps each column index `c` for `self._matrix[basis]` to the
 416        index `self._gadget_idxs[c]` in the global list of gadgets for
 417        this circuit for the `basis` gadget corresponding to column `c`.
 418    """
 419
 420    _gadget_legs_cache: Dict[Literal["Z", "X"], List[Optional[Tuple[int, ...]]]]
 421    """
 422        For `basis in ("Z", "X")`, the matrix `self._matrix[basis]`
 423        is the binary matrix encoding the qubits spanned by the
 424        `basis` gadgets.
 425    """
 426
 427    _num_qubits: int
 428    """
 429        The number of qubits spanned by this circuit.
 430    """
 431
 432    _angles: List[AngleExpr]
 433    """
 434        The global list of angles for the gadgets.
 435        The angle for the `basis` gadget corresponding to column index `c`
 436        of matrix `self._matrix[basis]` is given by:
 437
 438        ```py
 439            self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[basis][c]]
 440        ```
 441    """
 442
 443    _rev_gadget_idxs: List[Tuple[Literal["Z", "X"], int]]
 444    """
 445        Reverse gadget index list: to each global gadget index `idx` it returns
 446        a pair with the gadget basis `basis` and the column index `c` for the gadget
 447        in `self._gadget_idxs[basis]` and `self._matrix[basis]`.
 448    """
 449
 450    def __init__(self, num_qubits: int, gadgets: Sequence[PhaseGadget] = tuple()):
 451        if not isinstance(num_qubits, int) or num_qubits <= 0:
 452            raise TypeError("Number of qubits must be a positive integer.")
 453        if not isinstance(gadgets, Sequence) or not all(
 454            isinstance(g, PhaseGadget) for g in gadgets
 455        ):  # pylint: disable = C0330
 456            raise TypeError("Gadgets should be a sequence of PhaseGadget.")
 457        self._num_qubits = num_qubits
 458        # Fills the lists of original indices and angles for the gadgets:
 459        self._gadget_idxs = {"Z": [], "X": []}
 460        self._angles = []
 461        self._rev_gadget_idxs = []
 462        for i, gadget in enumerate(gadgets):
 463            self._rev_gadget_idxs.append(
 464                (gadget.basis, len(self._gadget_idxs[gadget.basis]))
 465            )
 466            self._gadget_idxs[gadget.basis].append(i)
 467            angle = gadget.angle
 468            if isinstance(angle, Angle):
 469                angle %= 2 * pi
 470            self._angles.append(angle)
 471        self._matrix = {}
 472        self._gadget_legs_cache = {}
 473        for basis in cast(Sequence[Literal["Z", "X"]], ("Z", "X")):
 474            # Create a zero matrix for the basis:
 475            self._matrix[basis] = np.zeros(
 476                shape=(num_qubits, len(self._gadget_idxs[basis])), dtype=np.uint8
 477            )
 478            # Set matrix elements to 1 for all qubits spanned by the gadgets for the basis:
 479            legs_cache: List[Optional[Tuple[int, ...]]] = []
 480            self._gadget_legs_cache[basis] = legs_cache
 481            for i, idx in enumerate(self._gadget_idxs[basis]):
 482                for q in gadgets[idx].qubits:
 483                    if not 0 <= q < num_qubits:
 484                        msg = f"Qubit {q} for gadget #{idx} out of bounds ({num_qubits = })"
 485                        raise IndexError(msg)
 486                    self._matrix[basis][q, i] = 1
 487                legs_cache.append(tuple(sorted(gadgets[idx].qubits)))
 488
 489    @property
 490    def num_qubits(self) -> int:
 491        """
 492        Readonly property exposing the number of qubits spanned by this phase circuit.
 493        """
 494        return self._num_qubits
 495
 496    @property
 497    def num_gadgets(self) -> int:
 498        """
 499        Readonly property exposing the number of phase gadgets in the circuit.
 500        """
 501        return len(self._angles)
 502
 503    @property
 504    def gadgets(self) -> Sequence[PhaseGadget]:
 505        """
 506        Readonly property returning the sequence of phase gadgets in this
 507        phase circuit, in order from first to last.
 508
 509        This collection is freshly generated at every call.
 510        """
 511        return tuple(self._iter_gadgets())
 512
 513    @property
 514    def as_readonly(self) -> "PhaseCircuitView":
 515        """
 516        Returns a readonly view on this circuit.
 517        """
 518        return PhaseCircuitView(self)
 519
 520    def set_angles(self, angles: Sequence[AngleExpr]) -> None:
 521        """
 522        Sets all angles for this circuit.
 523        """
 524        if not isinstance(angles, Sequence):
 525            raise TypeError(f"Expected Sequence[AngleExpr], found {type(angles)}.")
 526        for angle in angles:
 527            if not isinstance(angle, AngleExpr):
 528                raise TypeError(f"Expected AngleExpr, found {type(angle)}")
 529        if len(angles) != len(self._angles):
 530            raise ValueError(
 531                f"Expected {len(self._angles)} angles, " f"found {len(angles)} instead."
 532            )
 533        pi2 = 2 * pi
 534        self._angles = [
 535            angle % pi2 if isinstance(angle, Angle) else angle for angle in angles
 536        ]
 537
 538    def refresh_angle_vars(self, params: Union[str, Callable[[int], AngleVar]]) -> None:
 539        if isinstance(params, str):
 540            params = lambda i: AngleVar(f"{params}[{i}]", f"{params}_{i}")
 541        new_angles = [
 542            angle if isinstance(angle, Angle) else params(i)
 543            for i, angle in enumerate(self._angles)
 544        ]
 545        self.set_angles(new_angles)
 546
 547    def rx(self, qubit: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 548        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit X rotation."""
 549        if not isinstance(qubit, int) or not 0 <= qubit < self.num_qubits:
 550            raise TypeError(f"Invalid qubit {qubit}")
 551        self >>= X(angle) @ {qubit}
 552        return self
 553
 554    def rz(self, qubit: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 555        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Z rotation."""
 556        if not isinstance(qubit, int) or not 0 <= qubit < self.num_qubits:
 557            raise TypeError(f"Invalid qubit {qubit}")
 558        self >>= Z(angle) @ {qubit}
 559        return self
 560
 561    def ry(self, qubit: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 562        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Y rotation."""
 563        self.rx(qubit, +pi / 2)
 564        self.rz(qubit, angle)
 565        self.rx(qubit, -pi / 2)
 566        return self
 567
 568    def i(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 569        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit I gate."""
 570        return self
 571
 572    def x(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 573        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit X gate."""
 574        self.rx(qubit, pi)
 575        return self
 576
 577    def z(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 578        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit X gate."""
 579        self.rz(qubit, pi)
 580        return self
 581
 582    def y(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 583        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Y gate."""
 584        self.z(qubit)
 585        self.x(qubit)
 586        return self
 587
 588    def s(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 589        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit S gate."""
 590        self.rz(qubit, pi / 2)
 591        return self
 592
 593    def sdg(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 594        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Sdg gate."""
 595        self.rz(qubit, -pi / 2)
 596        return self
 597
 598    def v(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 599        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit S gate."""
 600        self.rx(qubit, pi / 2)
 601        return self
 602
 603    def vdg(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 604        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Sdg gate."""
 605        self.rx(qubit, -pi / 2)
 606        return self
 607
 608    def t(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 609        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit T gate."""
 610        self.rz(qubit, pi / 4)
 611        return self
 612
 613    def h(
 614        self, qubit: int, basis: Literal["Z", "X"] = "Z", sign: Literal[1, -1] = 1
 615    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 616        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Hadamard gate."""
 617        if basis not in ("Z", "X"):
 618            raise TypeError(f"Invalid basis {basis}.")
 619        if sign not in (1, -1):
 620            raise TypeError(f"Invalid sign {sign}.")
 621        if basis == "Z":
 622            self.rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 623            self.rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 624            self.rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 625        else:
 626            self.rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 627            self.rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 628            self.rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 629        return self
 630
 631    def cu1(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 632        """Phase gadget implementation of CU1 gate."""
 633        self.add_gadget(Z(-angle) @ {ctrl, tgt})
 634        self.rz(ctrl, angle)
 635        self.rz(tgt, angle)
 636        return self
 637
 638    def crz(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 639        """Phase gadget implementation of CRZ gate."""
 640        self.add_gadget(Z(-angle / 2) @ {ctrl, tgt})
 641        self.rz(tgt, angle / 2)
 642        return self
 643
 644    def cry(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 645        """Phase gadget implementation of CRY gate."""
 646        self.v(tgt)
 647        self.crz(ctrl, tgt, angle)
 648        self.vdg(tgt)
 649        return self
 650
 651    def crx(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: Angle) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 652        """Phase gadget implementation of CRX gate."""
 653        self.h(tgt)
 654        self.crz(ctrl, tgt, angle)
 655        self.h(tgt, sign=-1)
 656        return self
 657
 658    def cz(self, leg1: int, leg2: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 659        """Phase gadget implementation of CZ gate."""
 660        self.cu1(leg1, leg2, pi / 2)
 661        return self
 662
 663    def cy(self, leg1: int, leg2: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 664        """Phase gadget implementation of CY gate."""
 665        self.v(leg1)
 666        self.cz(leg1, leg2)
 667        self.vdg(leg2)
 668        return self
 669
 670    def cx(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 671        """Phase gadget implementation of CX gate."""
 672        self.h(tgt)
 673        self.cz(ctrl, tgt)
 674        self.h(tgt, sign=-1)
 675        return self
 676
 677    def u3(
 678        self, qubit: int, theta: AngleExpr, phi: AngleExpr, lam: AngleExpr
 679    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 680        """Phase gadget implementation of U3 gate."""
 681        self.rz(qubit, lam)
 682        self.ry(qubit, theta)
 683        self.rz(qubit, phi)
 684        return self
 685
 686    def ccz(self, leg1: int, leg2: int, leg3: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 687        """Phase gadget implementation of CCZ gate."""
 688        for bit in (leg1, leg2, leg3):
 689            self.rz(bit, pi / 4)
 690        for src, tgt in ((leg1, leg2), (leg2, leg3), (leg3, leg1)):
 691            self.add_gadget(Z(-pi / 4) @ {src, tgt})
 692        self.add_gadget(Z(pi / 4) @ (leg1, leg2, leg3))
 693        return self
 694
 695    def ccy(self, leg1: int, leg2: int, leg3: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 696        """Phase gadget implementation of CCX gate."""
 697        self.v(leg3)
 698        self.ccz(leg1, leg2, leg3)
 699        self.vdg(leg3)
 700        return self
 701
 702    def ccx(self, leg1: int, leg2: int, leg3: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 703        """Phase gadget implementation of CCX gate."""
 704        self.h(leg3)
 705        self.ccz(leg1, leg2, leg3)
 706        self.h(leg3, sign=-1)
 707        return self
 708
 709    def add_gadget(self, gadget: PhaseGadget) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 710        """
 711        Adds a phase gadget to the circuit.
 712        This is rather less efficient than passing the gadgets in the constructor,
 713        because the internal numpy arrays have to be copied in the process.
 714
 715        The circuit is modified in-place and then returned, as per the
 716        [fluent interface pattern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fluent_interface).
 717        """
 718        if not isinstance(gadget, PhaseGadget):
 719            raise TypeError(f"Expected PhaseGadget, found {type(gadget)}.")
 720        basis = gadget.basis
 721        gadget_idx = len(self._angles)
 722        new_col: npt.NDArray[np.uint64] = np.zeros(
 723            shape=(self._num_qubits, 1), dtype=np.uint64
 724        )
 725        for q in gadget.qubits:
 726            new_col[q] = 1
 727        self._matrix[basis] = np.append(self._matrix[basis], new_col, axis=1)
 728        self._rev_gadget_idxs.append((basis, len(self._gadget_idxs[gadget.basis])))
 729        self._gadget_idxs[basis].append(gadget_idx)
 730        self._angles.append(gadget.angle)
 731        self._gadget_legs_cache[basis].append(tuple(sorted(gadget.qubits)))
 732        return self
 733
 734    def copy(self):
 735        gadgets = [PhaseGadget(g.basis, g.angle, list(g.qubits)) for g in self.gadgets]
 736        return PhaseCircuit(self.num_qubits, gadgets)
 737
 738    def cx_count(
 739        self,
 740        topology: Topology,
 741        *,
 742        mapping: Optional[Union[Sequence[int], Dict[int, int]]] = None,
 743        method: Literal["naive", "paritysynth", "steiner-graysynth"] = "naive",
 744    ) -> int:
 745        """
 746            Returns the CX count for an implementation of this phase gadget
 747            on the given topology based on minimum spanning trees (MST).
 748
 749            The optional `mapping` keyword argument can be used to specify a mapping of
 750            logical (circuit) qubits to phyisical (topology) qubits.
 751
 752        Args:
 753            topology (Topology): Target device topology
 754            mapping (Optional[Union[Sequence[int], Dict[int, int]]], optional): Used qubit mapping. Defaults to None.
 755            method (Literal["naive", "paritysynth", "steiner", optional): Synthesis method. Defaults to "naive".
 756
 757        Raises:
 758            TypeError: If topology is not a Topology and if mapping is not a permutation of range(self.num_qubits).
 759
 760        Returns:
 761            int: The CX count.
 762        """
 763        if not isinstance(topology, Topology):
 764            raise TypeError(f"Expected Topology, found {type(topology)}.")
 765        if mapping is not None and len(mapping) != self.num_qubits:
 766            raise TypeError(
 767                f"Expected {self.num_qubits} mapping entries, " f"found {len(mapping)}"
 768            )
 769        if mapping is not None and isinstance(mapping, Sequence):
 770            mapping = {i: mapping[i] for i in range(len(mapping))}
 771        if mapping is not None and set(mapping.values()) != set(range(self.num_qubits)):
 772            raise TypeError(
 773                f"Expected mapping images [0, ..., {self.num_qubits-1}], "
 774                f"found {sorted(set(mapping.values()))}"
 775            )
 776        if mapping is not None:
 777            # use the reverse mapping on the topology
 778            topology = topology.mapped_fwd({mapping[i]: i for i in mapping})
 779
 780        if method != "naive":
 781            circuit = self.to_qiskit(topology, True, method)
 782            ops = circuit.count_ops()
 783            return ops.get("cx", 0)
 784        return self._cx_count(topology, {})
 785
 786    def mapped(
 787        self, mapping: Union[Sequence[int], Mapping[int, int]]
 788    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 789        """
 790        Returns a new phase circuit with the same gadgets but having
 791        qubits remapped according to the given mapping.
 792        """
 793        if isinstance(mapping, Sequence):
 794            if len(mapping) < self.num_qubits:
 795                raise ValueError(
 796                    f"Expected mapping keys [0,...,{self._num_qubits}], "
 797                    f"found {sorted(mapping)} instead."
 798                )
 799            _mapping = list(mapping)
 800        elif isinstance(mapping, Mapping):
 801            _mapping = []
 802            for i in range(self._num_qubits):
 803                if i not in mapping:
 804                    raise ValueError(
 805                        f"Expected mapping keys [0,...,{self._num_qubits}], "
 806                        f"found {sorted(mapping.keys())} instead."
 807                    )
 808                _mapping.append(mapping[i])
 809        else:
 810            raise TypeError(
 811                f"Expected Sequence[int] or Mapping[int, int], "
 812                f"found {type(mapping)} instead."
 813            )
 814        if set(_mapping) != set(range(self._num_qubits)):
 815            raise ValueError(
 816                f"Expected mapping values [0,...,{self._num_qubits}], "
 817                f"found {sorted(_mapping)} instead."
 818            )
 819        remapped_gadgets = [
 820            PhaseGadget(g.basis, g.angle, [_mapping[q] for q in g.qubits])
 821            for g in self.gadgets
 822        ]
 823        return PhaseCircuit(self._num_qubits, remapped_gadgets)
 824
 825    def color_flip(self) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 826        """
 827        Returns a new phase circuit with the same gadgets but having
 828        all basis switched from Z to X and vice versa.
 829        """
 830        flipped_gadgets = [
 831            PhaseGadget("X" if g.basis == "Z" else "Z", g.angle, g.qubits)
 832            for g in self.gadgets
 833        ]
 834        return PhaseCircuit(self._num_qubits, flipped_gadgets)
 835
 836    def dagger(self) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 837        """
 838        Returns a new phase circuit with the same gadgets but having
 839        all angles negated.
 840        """
 841        inverted_gadgets = [
 842            PhaseGadget(g.basis, -g.angle, g.qubits) for g in reversed(self.gadgets)
 843        ]
 844        return PhaseCircuit(self._num_qubits, inverted_gadgets)
 845
 846    def normalize(self) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 847        """Fuse and reorder gadgets of the same basis."""
 848        d = OrderedDict()
 849        basis = None
 850        circ = PhaseCircuit(self._num_qubits)
 851        for g in self.gadgets:
 852            if g.basis != basis:
 853                for legs, angle in d.items():
 854                    circ >>= PhaseGadget(basis, angle, legs)
 855                basis = g.basis
 856            else:
 857                if g.qubits not in d:
 858                    d[g.qubits] = 0
 859                d[g.qubits] += g.angle
 860        for legs, angle in d.items():
 861            circ >>= PhaseGadget(basis, angle, legs)
 862
 863        return circ
 864
 865    def to_qiskit(
 866        self,
 867        topology: Topology,
 868        simplified: bool = True,
 869        method: Literal["naive", "paritysynth", "steiner-graysynth"] = "naive",
 870        cx_synth: Literal["permrowcol", "naive"] = "naive",
 871        return_cx: bool = False,
 872        reallocate: bool = False,
 873    ) -> Any:
 874        """Generates a qiskit QuantumCircuit equivalent to this PhaseCircuit.
 875
 876        Args:
 877            topology (Topology): Target device topology
 878            simplified (bool, optional): Simplifiy the PhaseCircuit before synthesis. Defaults to True.
 879            method (Literal["naive", "paritysynth", "steiner", optional): Which method of synthesis should be used. Defaults to "naive".
 880            cx_synth (Literal["permrowcol", "naive"], optional): Which method should be used for synthesizing the final CXCircuit. Defaults to "naive".
 881            return_cx (bool, optional): Whether to return the final CXCircuit separately without synthesizing it. Defaults to False.
 882            reallocate (bool, optional): Whether qubit reallocation is allowed when synthesizing the final CXCircuit. Defaults to False.
 883
 884        Raises:
 885            ModuleNotFoundError: Requires Qiskit to be installed
 886
 887        Returns:
 888            qiskit.QuantumCircuit: The synthesized equivalent circuit
 889            CXCircuit (optional): The final CNOTs of the circuit not yet concatinated to the qiskit circuit.
 890        """
 891        try:
 892            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
 893            from qiskit.circuit import QuantumCircuit
 894        except ModuleNotFoundError as e:
 895            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'qiskit' library.") from e
 896        if simplified:
 897            phase_circuit = self.simplified()
 898        else:
 899            phase_circuit = self.cloned()
 900        if method == "naive":
 901            cxs = CXCircuit(topology)
 902            gates = phase_circuit.gadgets
 903        elif method == "paritysynth":
 904            gates, cxs = phase_circuit._paritysynth(topology)
 905        elif method == "steiner-graysynth":
 906            gates, cxs = phase_circuit._steiner_graysynth(topology)
 907        circuit = QuantumCircuit(self.num_qubits)
 908        for gate in gates:
 909            if isinstance(gate, PhaseGadget):
 910                gate.on_qiskit_circuit(topology, circuit)
 911            else:
 912                circuit.cx(*gate)
 913        if cx_synth != "naive":
 914            cxs = CXCircuit.from_parity_matrix(
 915                cxs.parity_matrix(), topology, method=cx_synth, reallocate=reallocate
 916            )
 917        if return_cx:
 918            return circuit, cxs
 919        new_cxs = cxs.to_qiskit(method="naive")
 920        circuit.compose(new_cxs, inplace=True)
 921        circuit.metadata = {"final_layout": new_cxs.metadata["final_layout"]}
 922        return circuit
 923
 924    def _paritysynth(
 925        self, topology: Topology
 926    ) -> Tuple[List[Union[PhaseGadget, Tuple[int, int]]], CXCircuit]:
 927        """Function generating a sequence of CNOTs and single qubit PhaseGadgets representing this PhaseCircuit.
 928        For synthesis, the method from [1] is used.
 929
 930        [1] Vandaele, Vivien, Simon Martiel, and Timothe Goubault de Brugire. "Phase polynomials synthesis algorithms for NISQ architectures and beyond." Quantum Science and Technology 7.4 (2022): 045027.
 931        https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/2058-9565/ac5a0e/pdf?casa_token=wC-rL5mT7eUAAAAA:tlE5CNn64TQR-Xp8eqPxlQEJyjUSUn1jF6Z6pApyJa9DPZKeYvFAnthRuWNnpS1vvz11oLtH0HPG
 932
 933        Args:
 934            topology (Topology): Topology representing the target quantum computer
 935
 936        Raises:
 937            ModuleNotFoundError: Networkx is required to run this.
 938
 939        Returns:
 940            List[Union[PhaseGadget, Tuple[int, int]]]: A list containing single qubit phase gadgets and tuples representing CNOT(ctrl, trgt)
 941            CXCircuit: A CXCircuit containing the cnots to make the linear function of cnots that are optimized out of the phase gadgets.
 942        """
 943        try:
 944            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
 945            import networkx as nx
 946        except ModuleNotFoundError as _:
 947            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'networkx' library.")
 948        blocks = []
 949        block = []
 950        if len(self.gadgets) == 0:
 951            return [], CXCircuit(topology, [])
 952        basis = self._rev_gadget_idxs[0][0]
 953        for b, idx in self._rev_gadget_idxs:
 954            if b == basis:
 955                block.append(idx)
 956            else:
 957                blocks.append((basis, block))
 958                block = [idx]
 959                basis = b
 960        if len(block) > 0:
 961            blocks.append((basis, block))
 962        if len(blocks) == 0:
 963            return [], CXCircuit(topology)
 964        gates = []
 965        CX_aggregate = []
 966
 967        def pick_root(mst, matrix_dict, direction):
 968            best_root, best_score = None, None
 969            for root in mst.nodes:
 970                ladder = []
 971                x_matrix = matrix_dict["X"].copy()
 972                z_matrix = matrix_dict["Z"].copy()
 973                for head, tail in reversed(
 974                    list(nx.bfs_edges(mst, source=root))
 975                ):  # trgt, ctrl
 976                    trgt, ctrl = direction(head, tail)
 977                    ladder.append((ctrl, trgt))
 978                    x_matrix[trgt] ^= x_matrix[ctrl]
 979                    z_matrix[ctrl] ^= z_matrix[trgt]
 980                score = np.sum(x_matrix) + np.sum(
 981                    z_matrix
 982                )  # The orignal paper wanted argmin(sort()) which is ill-defined. I took the liberty to use h(P^X) instead
 983                if not best_score or best_score > score:
 984                    best_root, best_score = root, score
 985            return best_root
 986
 987        def idx2terminals(idx, basis):
 988            return [
 989                q
 990                for q in range(topology.num_qubits)
 991                if self._matrix[basis][q, idx] == 1
 992            ]
 993
 994        for current_basis, block in blocks:
 995            if current_basis == "Z":
 996                direction = lambda ctrl, trgt: (ctrl, trgt)
 997            else:
 998                direction = lambda ctrl, trgt: (trgt, ctrl)
 999            while len(block) > 0:
1000                # Pick the cheapest gadget
1001                sizes = [
1002                    topology.steiner_tree(idx2terminals(i, current_basis)).size()
1003                    for i in block
1004                ]
1005                index = block[np.argmin(sizes)]
1006                terminals = idx2terminals(index, current_basis)
1007                if len(terminals) > 1:
1008                    # Get the CX ladder for the gaddget
1009                    mst = topology.steiner_tree(terminals)
1010                    for head, tail in reversed(
1011                        list(nx.bfs_edges(mst, source=terminals[0]))
1012                    ):  # Use bfs to help CX depth
1013                        ctrl, trgt = direction(head, tail)
1014                        bitstring = self._matrix[current_basis][:, index]
1015                        if bitstring[head] == 0:
1016                            self.conj_by_cx(ctrl, trgt)
1017                            gates.append((ctrl, trgt))
1018                            CX_aggregate.append((ctrl, trgt))
1019
1020                    remaining_X_idxs = [
1021                        i for basis, bl in blocks for i in bl if basis == "X"
1022                    ]
1023                    remaining_Z_idxs = [
1024                        i for basis, bl in blocks for i in bl if basis == "Z"
1025                    ]
1026                    remaining_gadgets = {
1027                        "X": self._matrix["X"][:, remaining_X_idxs],
1028                        "Z": self._matrix["Z"][:, remaining_Z_idxs],
1029                    }
1030                    root = pick_root(mst, remaining_gadgets, direction)
1031                    for head, tail in reversed(
1032                        list(nx.bfs_edges(mst, source=root))
1033                    ):  # trgt, ctrl
1034                        trgt, ctrl = direction(head, tail)
1035                        self.conj_by_cx(ctrl, trgt)
1036                        gates.append((ctrl, trgt))
1037                        CX_aggregate.append((ctrl, trgt))
1038                else:
1039                    # The chosen gadget is trivial
1040                    root = terminals[0]
1041                gates.append(
1042                    PhaseGadget(
1043                        current_basis,
1044                        self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[current_basis][index]],
1045                        [root],
1046                    )
1047                )
1048                # Sanity check:
1049                assert (
1050                    np.sum(self._matrix[current_basis][:, index]) == 1
1051                ), "The chosen gadget was not properly reduced and cannot be removed."
1052                # Remove that parity from the matrix
1053                block.remove(index)
1054
1055        cnots_circuit = CXCircuit(
1056            topology,
1057            [CXCircuitLayer(topology, [cnot]) for cnot in reversed(CX_aggregate)],
1058        )
1059        return gates, cnots_circuit
1060
1061    def _steiner_graysynth(
1062        self, topology: Topology
1063    ) -> Tuple[List[Union[PhaseGadget, Tuple[int, int]]], CXCircuit]:
1064        """Function generating a sequence of CNOTs and single qubit PhaseGadgets representing this PhaseCircuit.
1065        For synthesis, the method from [1] is used.
1066
1067        [1] Meijer - van de Griend, Arianne, and Ross Duncan. "Architecture-aware synthesis of phase polynomials for NISQ devices." arXiv preprint arXiv:2004.06052 (2020).
1068        https://arxiv.org/pdf/2004.06052.pdf
1069
1070        Args:
1071            topology (Topology): Topology representing the target quantum computer
1072
1073        Raises:
1074            ModuleNotFoundError: Networkx is required to run this.
1075
1076        Returns:
1077            List[Union[PhaseGadget, Tuple[int, int]]]: A list containing single qubit phase gadgets and tuples representing CNOT(ctrl, trgt)
1078            CXCircuit: A CXCircuit containing the cnots to make the linear function of cnots that are optimized out of the phase gadgets.
1079        """
1080        try:
1081            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
1082            import networkx as nx
1083        except ModuleNotFoundError as _:
1084            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'networkx' library.")
1085
1086        blocks = []
1087        block = []
1088        if len(self.gadgets) == 0:
1089            return [], CXCircuit(topology, [])
1090        basis = self._rev_gadget_idxs[0][0]
1091        for b, idx in self._rev_gadget_idxs:
1092            if b == basis:
1093                block.append(idx)
1094            else:
1095                blocks.append((basis, block))
1096                block = [idx]
1097                basis = b
1098        if len(block) > 0:
1099            blocks.append((basis, block))
1100        if len(blocks) == 0:
1101            return [], CXCircuit(topology)
1102        gates = []
1103        CX_aggregate = []
1104
1105        def idx2bitstring(idx, basis):
1106            return self._matrix[basis][:, idx]
1107
1108        def place_cnot(ctrl, trgt, basis):
1109            if basis == "Z":
1110                gates.append((ctrl, trgt))
1111                CX_aggregate.append((ctrl, trgt))
1112                self.conj_by_cx(ctrl, trgt)
1113            else:
1114                place_cnot(trgt, ctrl, "Z")
1115
1116        def ones_recursion(gadgets, subgraph, row, basis):
1117            to_remove = []
1118            for g in gadgets:  # Remove trivial gadgets
1119                bitstring = idx2bitstring(g, basis)
1120                if np.sum(bitstring) == 1:
1121                    gates.append(
1122                        PhaseGadget(
1123                            basis,
1124                            self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[basis][g]],
1125                            [
1126                                q
1127                                for q in range(topology.num_qubits)
1128                                if bitstring[q] == 1
1129                            ],
1130                        )
1131                    )
1132                    to_remove.append(g)
1133            [gadgets.remove(g) for g in to_remove]
1134            if gadgets:
1135                neighbors = [q for q in iter(topology.adjacent(row)) if q in subgraph]
1136                n = neighbors[
1137                    np.argmax(
1138                        [
1139                            len([g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[q] == 1])
1140                            for q in neighbors
1141                        ]
1142                    )
1143                ]
1144
1145                if len([g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[n] == 1]) > 0:
1146                    place_cnot(row, n, basis)
1147                    for gadget in gadgets:
1148                        qubits = [
1149                            q for q in subgraph if idx2bitstring(gadget, basis)[q] == 1
1150                        ]
1151                        if len(qubits) == 1:
1152                            gates.append(
1153                                PhaseGadget(
1154                                    basis,
1155                                    self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[basis][gadget]],
1156                                    qubits,
1157                                )
1158                            )
1159                            gadgets.remove(gadget)
1160
1161                else:
1162                    place_cnot(n, row, basis)
1163                    place_cnot(row, n, basis)
1164                zeroes = [g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[row] == 0]
1165                ones = [g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[row] == 1]
1166                zeroes_recursion(zeroes, [i for i in subgraph if i != row], basis)
1167                ones_recursion(ones, [i for i in subgraph], row, basis)
1168
1169        def zeroes_recursion(gadgets, subgraph, basis):
1170            if subgraph and gadgets:
1171                rows = topology.non_cutting_qubits(subgraph)
1172                counts = [
1173                    [
1174                        np.sum(idx2bitstring(g, basis))
1175                        for g in gadgets
1176                        if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[r] == 1
1177                    ]
1178                    for r in rows
1179                ]
1180                row = rows[
1181                    np.argmax(
1182                        [
1183                            np.max(counts[i]) if counts[i] else topology.num_qubits
1184                            for i, r in enumerate(rows)
1185                        ]
1186                    )
1187                ]
1188                zeroes = [g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[row] == 0]
1189                ones = [g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[row] == 1]
1190                zeroes_recursion(zeroes, [i for i in subgraph if i != row], basis)
1191                ones_recursion(ones, [i for i in subgraph], row, basis)
1192
1193        for basis, block in blocks:
1194            for i in block:
1195                bitstring = idx2bitstring(i, basis)
1196                if np.sum(bitstring) == 1:
1197                    gates.append(
1198                        PhaseGadget(
1199                            basis,
1200                            self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[basis][i]],
1201                            [
1202                                q
1203                                for q in range(topology.num_qubits)
1204                                if bitstring[q] == 1
1205                            ],
1206                        )
1207                    )
1208                    block.remove(i)
1209            zeroes_recursion(block, [i for i in range(topology.num_qubits)], basis)
1210
1211        cnots_circuit = CXCircuit(
1212            topology,
1213            [CXCircuitLayer(topology, [cnot]) for cnot in reversed(CX_aggregate)],
1214        )
1215        return gates, cnots_circuit

1231    def to_svg(
1232        self,
1233        *,
1234        zcolor: str = "#CCFFCC",
1235        xcolor: str = "#FF8888",
1236        hscale: float = 1.0,

1242
1243    def to_svg(
1244        self,
1245        *,
1246        zcolor: str = "#CCFFCC",
1247        xcolor: str = "#FF8888",
1248        hscale: float = 1.0,
1249        vscale: float = 1.0,
1250        scale: float = 1.0,
1251        svg_code_only: bool = False,
1252    ) -> Any:
1253        """
1254        Returns an SVG representation of this circuit, using
1255        the ZX calculus to express phase gadgets.
1256
1257        The keyword arguments `zcolor` and `xcolor` can be used to
1258        specify a colour for the Z and X basis spiders in the circuit.
1259        The keyword arguments `hscale` and `vscale` can be used to
1260        scale the circuit representation horizontally and vertically.
1261        The keyword argument `scale` can be used to scale the circuit
1262        representation isotropically.
1263        The keyword argument `svg_code_only` (default `False`) can be used
1264        to specify that the SVG code itself be returned, rather than the
1265        IPython `SVG` object.
1266        """
1267        if not isinstance(zcolor, str):
1268            raise TypeError("Keyword argument 'zcolor' must be string.")
1269        if not isinstance(xcolor, str):
1270            raise TypeError("Keyword argument 'xcolor' must be string.")
1271        if not isinstance(hscale, (int, float)) or hscale <= 0.0:
1272            raise TypeError("Keyword argument 'hscale' must be positive float.")
1273        if not isinstance(vscale, (int, float)) or vscale <= 0.0:
1274            raise TypeError("Keyword argument 'vscale' must be positive float.")
1275        if not isinstance(scale, (int, float)) or scale <= 0.0:
1276            raise TypeError("Keyword argument 'scale' must be positive float.")
1277        return self._to_svg(
1278            zcolor=zcolor,
1279            xcolor=xcolor,
1280            hscale=hscale,
1281            vscale=vscale,
1282            scale=scale,
1283            svg_code_only=svg_code_only,
1284        )  # type: ignore[call-overload]

1293        vscale: float = 1.0,
1294        scale: float = 1.0,
1295        svg_code_only: Literal[True],
1296    ) -> str:
1297        ...

1299    @overload
1300    def _to_svg(
1301        self,
1302        *,
1303        zcolor: str = "#CCFFCC",
1304        xcolor: str = "#FF8888",
1305        hscale: float = 1.0,
1306        vscale: float = 1.0,
1307        scale: float = 1.0,
1308        svg_code_only: Literal[False] = False,
1309    ) -> Any:
1310        ...
1311
1312    def _to_svg(
1313        self,
1314        *,
1315        zcolor: str = "#CCFFCC",
1316        xcolor: str = "#FF8888",
1317        hscale: float = 1.0,
1318        vscale: float = 1.0,
1319        scale: float = 1.0,
1320        svg_code_only: bool = False,
1321    ) -> Any:
1322        # pylint: disable = too-many-locals, too-many-statements
1323        # TODO: clean this up, restructure into a separate function, reuse for opt circuit
1324        num_qubits = self._num_qubits
1325        vscale *= scale
1326        hscale *= scale
1327        gadgets = self.gadgets
1328        num_digits = int(ceil(log10(num_qubits)))
1329        line_height = int(ceil(30 * vscale))
1330        row_width = int(ceil(120 * hscale))
1331        pad_x = int(ceil(10 * hscale))
1332        margin_x = int(ceil(40 * hscale))
1333        pad_y = int(ceil(20 * vscale))
1334        r = pad_y // 2 - 2
1335        font_size = 2 * r
1336        pad_x += font_size * (num_digits + 1)
1337        delta_fst = row_width // 4
1338        delta_snd = 2 * row_width // 4
1339        width = 2 * pad_x + 2 * margin_x + row_width * len(gadgets)
1340        height = pad_y + line_height * (num_qubits + 1)
1341        builder = SVGBuilder(width, height)
1342        levels: List[int] = [0 for _ in range(num_qubits)]
1343        max_lvl = 0
1344        for gadget in gadgets:
1345            fill = zcolor if gadget.basis == "Z" else xcolor
1346            other_fill = xcolor if gadget.basis == "Z" else zcolor
1347            qubit_span = range(min(gadget.qubits), max(gadget.qubits) + 1)
1348            lvl = max(levels[q] for q in qubit_span)
1349            max_lvl = max(max_lvl, lvl)
1350            x = pad_x + margin_x + lvl * row_width
1351            for q in qubit_span:
1352                levels[q] = lvl + 1
1353            if len(gadget.qubits) > 1:
1354                text_y = pad_y + min(gadget.qubits) * line_height + line_height // 2
1355                for q in gadget.qubits:
1356                    y = pad_y + (q + 1) * line_height
1357                    builder.line((x, y), (x + delta_fst, text_y))
1358                for q in gadget.qubits:
1359                    y = pad_y + (q + 1) * line_height
1360                    builder.circle((x, y), r, fill)
1361                builder.line((x + delta_fst, text_y), (x + delta_snd, text_y))
1362                builder.circle((x + delta_fst, text_y), r, other_fill)
1363                builder.circle((x + delta_snd, text_y), r, fill)
1364                builder.text(
1365                    (x + delta_snd + 2 * r, text_y),
1366                    str(gadget.angle),
1367                    font_size=font_size,
1368                )
1369            else:
1370                for q in gadget.qubits:
1371                    y = pad_y + (q + 1) * line_height
1372                    builder.circle((x, y), r, fill)
1373                builder.text(
1374                    (x + r, y - line_height // 3),
1375                    str(gadget.angle),
1376                    font_size=font_size,
1377                )
1378        width = 2 * pad_x + 2 * margin_x + row_width * (2 * max_lvl + 1) // 2
1379        _builder = SVGBuilder(width, height)
1380        for q in range(num_qubits):
1381            y = pad_y + (q + 1) * line_height
1382            _builder.line((pad_x, y), (width - pad_x, y))
1383            _builder.text((0, y), f"{str(q):>{num_digits}}", font_size=font_size)
1384            _builder.text(
1385                (width - pad_x + r, y), f"{str(q):>{num_digits}}", font_size=font_size
1386            )
1387        _builder >>= builder
1388        svg_code = repr(_builder)
1389        if svg_code_only:
1390            return svg_code
1391        try:
1392            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
1393            from IPython.core.display import SVG  # type: ignore
1394        except ModuleNotFoundError as e:
1395            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'IPython' library.") from e
1396        return SVG(svg_code)
1397
1398    def cloned(self) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1399        """
1400        Produces an exact copy of this phase circuit.
1401        """
1402        return PhaseCircuit(self._num_qubits, tuple(self._iter_gadgets()))
1403
1404    def conj_by_cx(self, ctrl: int, trgt: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1405        """
1406        Conjugates this circuit by a CX gate with given control/target.
1407        The circuit is modified in-place and then returned, as per the
1408        [fluent interface pattern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fluent_interface).
1409        """
1410        if not 0 <= ctrl < self._num_qubits:
1411            raise ValueError(f"Invalid control qubit {ctrl}.")
1412        if not 0 <= trgt < self._num_qubits:
1413            raise ValueError(f"Invalid target qubit {trgt}.")
1414        self._matrix["Z"][ctrl, :] = (
1415            self._matrix["Z"][ctrl, :] + self._matrix["Z"][trgt, :]
1416        ) % 2
1417        self._matrix["X"][trgt, :] = (
1418            self._matrix["X"][trgt, :] + self._matrix["X"][ctrl, :]
1419        ) % 2
1420        # Update legs caches:
1421        z_gadget_legs_cache = self._gadget_legs_cache["Z"]
1422        for z_gadget_idx in np.where(self._matrix["Z"][trgt, :] == 1)[0]:
1423            z_gadget_legs_cache[z_gadget_idx] = None
1424        x_gadget_legs_cache = self._gadget_legs_cache["X"]
1425        for x_gadget_idx in np.where(self._matrix["X"][ctrl, :] == 1)[0]:
1426            x_gadget_legs_cache[x_gadget_idx] = None
1427        return self
