1534    def simplified(self) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1535        """
1536        Returns a new phase circuit which has been simplified using the
1537        commutation and fusion rules for gadgets.
1538        """
1539        # pylint: disable = too-many-locals, too-many-branches, too-many-statements
1540        num_qubits = self.num_qubits
1541        gadgets = [g for g in self.gadgets if not g.angle.is_zero]
1542        # Groups of gadgets of the same basis, fused together where possible
1543        GadgetGroup = Tuple[Literal["Z", "X"], Dict[int, AngleExpr]]
1544        groups: List[GadgetGroup] = [("Z", {})]
1545        # Perform the grouping and fusion
1546        for g in gadgets:
1547            basis, angles = groups[-1]
1548            g_basis = g.basis
1549            g_qubits = _frozenset_to_int(g.qubits)
1550            g_angle = g.angle
1551            # Add the gadget to the current group, or create a new group.
1552            if g_basis == basis:
1553                # Add gadget to current group (fuse if possible)
1554                if g_qubits in angles:
1555                    angles[g_qubits] += g_angle
1556                else:
1557                    angles[g_qubits] = g_angle
1558            else:
1559                # Create a new group (basis has changed)
1560                groups.append((g_basis, {g_qubits: g_angle}))
1561        # The pi gates will be collected separately here
1562        pi_gates = {
1563            "Z": [0 for _ in range(num_qubits)],
1564            "X": [0 for _ in range(num_qubits)],
1565        }
1566        # Perform all commutations, fusions and pi gadget simplifications
1567        # TODO: explain with comments how the jumplist works
1568        # jumplist: Dict[int, Optional[Dict[int, int]]] = {}
1569        for i, (basis, angles) in enumerate(
1570            groups
1571        ):  # pylint: disable = too-many-nested-blocks
1572            # Try commuting all gadgets to the left as much as possible
1573            for qubits, angle in angles.items():
1574                if angle == 0:
1575                    # Skip zeroed gadgets
1576                    continue
1577                # Try to commute the gadget to the left as much as possible
1578                j = i  # j is the current group to which the gadget has been commuted
1579                obstacle_found = False  # this records whether we found an obstacle
1580                while not obstacle_found and j >= 2:
1581                    # if j in jumplist:
1582                    #     j_jump = jumplist[j]
1583                    #     if j_jump is not None and qubits in j_jump:
1584                    #         print("Jump", i, j, j_jump[qubits], bin(qubits))
1585                    #         j = j_jump[qubits]
1586                    #         break
1587                    _, angles_commute = groups[j - 1]  # angles to commute through
1588                    for qubits_commute, angle_commute in angles_commute.items():
1589                        if angle_commute.is_zero:
1590                            # Zero angle gadget, not an obstable
1591                            continue
1592                        # https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9829578/fast-way-of-counting-non-zero-bits-in-positive-integer
1593                        if bin(qubits & qubits_commute).count("1") % 2 != 0:
1594                            # Odd number of shared legs, obstacle found
1595                            obstacle_found = True
1596                            break
1597                    if not obstacle_found:
1598                        # Go to the next group of same basis down the list
1599                        j -= 2
1600                # if i in jumplist and jumplist[i] is not None:
1601                #     jumplist[i][qubits] = j # type: ignore # TODO: do this right
1602                # else:
1603                #     jumplist[i] = {
1604                #         qubits: j
1605                #     }
1606                # Fuse the gadget into the group, and apply pi gate simplification
1607                pi_gadget = False
1608                if j < i:
1609                    # for k in range(j+1, i, 2):
1610                    #     jumplist[k] = None
1611                    # We managed to perform some non-trivial commutation
1612                    angles[qubits] = Angle.zero
1613                    _, angles_fuse = groups[j]
1614                    if qubits in angles_fuse:
1615                        # Fuse with existing gadget on same qubits and same basis
1616                        angles_fuse[qubits] += angle
1617                    else:
1618                        # Add gadget to group
1619                        angles_fuse[qubits] = angle
1620                    if angles_fuse[qubits].is_pi:
1621                        # This is a pi gadget, further simplification to be performed
1622                        angles_fuse[
1623                            qubits
1624                        ] = Angle.zero  # Remove gadget from this group
1625                        pi_gadget = True
1626                elif angle.is_pi:
1627                    # We didn't manage to commute the gadget, but it is a pi gadget
1628                    angles[qubits] = Angle.zero  # Remove gadget from this group
1629                    pi_gadget = True
1630                if pi_gadget:
1631                    # pi gadget
1632                    for k in range(0, j)[::-2]:
1633                        # Commute through gadgets below of other basis, flipping sign if necessary
1634                        _, angles_k = groups[k]
1635                        for qubits_k in angles_k:
1636                            if bin(qubits_k & qubits).count("1") % 2 == 1:
1637                                # Odd number of legs in comon: flip sign
1638                                angles_k[qubits_k] *= -1
1639                    for q in _int_to_iterator(qubits):
1640                        # Break into single-qubit pi gates, recorded separately (at start of circ)
1641                        pi_gates[basis][q] += 1
1642        # Create the new list of gadgets
1643        new_gadgets: List[PhaseGadget] = []
1644        for q in range(num_qubits):
1645            if pi_gates["Z"][q] % 2 == 1:
1646                # Single-qubit pi Z gate
1647                new_gadgets.append(PhaseGadget("Z", pi, {q}))
1648        for q in range(num_qubits):
1649            if pi_gates["X"][q] % 2 == 1:
1650                # Single-qubit pi X gate
1651                new_gadgets.append(PhaseGadget("X", pi, {q}))
1652        for basis, angles in groups:
1653            for qubits, angle in angles.items():
1654                if isinstance(angle, Angle):
1655                    angle = angle % (2 * pi)
1656                if angle != 0:  # skip zero angle gadgets
1657                    new_gadgets.append(
1658                        PhaseGadget(basis, angle, _int_to_frozenset(qubits))
1659                    )
1660        # Return a new phase circuit.
1661        return PhaseCircuit(num_qubits, new_gadgets)
1662
1663    def __eq__(self, other: Any) -> bool:
1664        if self is other:
1665            return True
1666        if not isinstance(other, PhaseCircuit):
1667            return NotImplemented
1668        if self.num_gadgets != other.num_gadgets:
1669            return NotImplemented
1670        if self.num_qubits != other.num_qubits:
1671            return False
1672        return all(g == h for g, h in zip(self._iter_gadgets(), other._iter_gadgets()))
1673
1674    def __irshift__(
1675        self, gadgets: Union[PhaseGadget, "PhaseCircuit", Sequence[PhaseGadget]]
1676    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1677        if isinstance(gadgets, PhaseGadget):
1678            gadgets = [gadgets]
1679        elif isinstance(gadgets, PhaseCircuit):
1680            gadgets = gadgets.gadgets
1681        if not isinstance(gadgets, Sequence) or not all(
1682            isinstance(gadget, PhaseGadget) for gadget in gadgets
1683        ):
1684            raise TypeError(
1685                f"Expected phase gadget or sequence of phase gadgets, found {gadgets}."
1686            )
1687        for gadget in gadgets:
1688            self.add_gadget(gadget)
1689        return self
1690
1691    def __rshift__(
1692        self, gadgets: Union[PhaseGadget, "PhaseCircuit", Sequence[PhaseGadget]]
1693    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1694        circ: PhaseCircuit = PhaseCircuit(self.num_qubits, [])
1695        circ >>= self
1696        circ >>= gadgets
1697        return circ
1698
1699    def _reindex(self, idx: int) -> int:
1700        if 0 <= idx < self.num_gadgets:
1701            return idx
1702        if -self.num_gadgets <= idx < 0:
1703            return idx + self.num_gadgets
1704        raise IndexError(f"Invalid gadget index {idx}")
1705
1706    @overload
1707    def __getitem__(self, idx: int) -> PhaseGadget:
1708        ...
1709
1710    @overload
1711    def __getitem__(self, idx: slice) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1712        ...
1713
1714    def __getitem__(self, idx: Union[int, slice]) -> Union[PhaseGadget, "PhaseCircuit"]:
1715        if isinstance(idx, int):
1716            idx = self._reindex(idx)
1717            basis, col_idx = self._rev_gadget_idxs[idx]
1718            col = self._matrix[basis][:, col_idx]
1719            angle = self._angles[idx]
1720            return PhaseGadget(
1721                basis, angle, {i for i, b in enumerate(col) if b % 2 == 1}
1722            )
1723        if isinstance(idx, slice):
1724            start, stop, step = (idx.start, idx.stop, idx.step)
1725            return PhaseCircuit(
1726                self.num_qubits, list(self._iter_gadgets(start, stop, step))
1727            )
1728        raise TypeError(f"Expected int or slice, found {type(idx)}")
1729
1730    def __len__(self) -> int:
1731        return self.num_gadgets
1732
1733    def _iter_gadgets(
1734        self,
1735        start: Optional[int] = None,
1736        stop: Optional[int] = None,
1737        step: Optional[int] = None,
1738    ) -> Iterator[PhaseGadget]:
1739        if start is None:
1740            start = 0
1741        else:
1742            start = self._reindex(start)
1743        if stop is not None:
1744            stop = self._reindex(stop)
1745        for idx, angle in islice(enumerate(self._angles), start, stop, step):
1746            basis, col_idx = self._rev_gadget_idxs[idx]
1747            col = self._matrix[basis][:, col_idx]
1748            yield PhaseGadget(
1749                basis, angle, {i for i, b in enumerate(col) if b % 2 == 1}
1750            )
1751
1752    def _cx_count(
1753        self, topology: Topology, cache: Dict[int, Dict[Tuple[int, ...], int]]
1754    ) -> int:
1755        """
1756        Returns the CX count for an implementation of this phase circuit
1757        on the given topology based on minimum spanning trees (MST).
1758        """
1759        # pylint: disable = too-many-locals
1760        count = 0
1761        for basis in ("Z", "X"):
1762            basis = cast(Literal["Z", "X"], basis)
1763            gadget_legs_cache = self._gadget_legs_cache[basis]
1764            for j, col in enumerate(self._matrix[basis].T):
1765                angle = self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[basis][j]]
1766                if angle.is_zero_or_pi:
1767                    # Skip zero and pi gadgets
1768                    continue
1769                legs = gadget_legs_cache[j]
1770                if legs is None:
1771                    legs = tuple(int(i) for i in np.where(col == 1)[0])
1772                    gadget_legs_cache[j] = legs
1773                num_legs = len(legs)
1774                if num_legs <= 1:
1775                    # Skip single-qubit gates
1776                    continue
1777                _cache = cache.get(num_legs, None)
1778                if _cache is None:
1779                    _cache = {}
1780                    cache[num_legs] = _cache
1781                legs_count = _cache.get(legs, None)
1782                if legs_count is None:
1783                    legs_count = topology.steiner_tree(legs).size()
1784                    _cache[legs] = legs_count
1785                count += legs_count
1786        return count
1787
1788    def _repr_svg_(self) -> Any:
1789        """
1790        Magic method for IPython/Jupyter pretty-printing.
1791        See https://ipython.readthedocs.io/en/stable/api/generated/IPython.display.html
1792        """
1793        return self._to_svg(svg_code_only=True)
1794
1795    @staticmethod
1796    def random(
1797        num_qubits: int,
1798        num_gadgets: int,
1799        *,
1800        parametric: Union[None, str, Callable[[int], AngleVar]] = None,
1801        angle_subdivision: int = 4,
1802        min_legs: int = 1,
1803        max_legs: Optional[int] = None,
1804        diagonal: bool = False,
1805        rng_seed: Optional[int] = None,
1806    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1807        """
1808        Generates a random circuit of mixed ZX phase gadgets on the given number of qubits,
1809        with the given number of gadgets.
1810
1811        The optional argument `angle_subdivision` (default: 4) can be used to specify the
1812        denominator in the random fractional multiples of pi used as values for the angles.
1813
1814        The optional arguments `min_legs` (default: 1, minimum: 1) and `max_legs`
1815        (default: `None`, minimum `min_legs`) can be used to specify the minimum and maximum
1816        number of legs for the phase gadgets. If `None`, `max_legs` is set to `len(qubits)`.
1817
1818        The optional argument `rng_seed` (default: `None`) is used as seed for the RNG.
1819        """
1820        if not isinstance(num_qubits, int) or num_qubits <= 0:
1821            raise TypeError("Number of qubits must be a positive integer.")
1822        if not isinstance(num_gadgets, int) or num_gadgets < 0:
1823            raise TypeError("Number of gadgets must be non-negative integer.")
1824        if not isinstance(angle_subdivision, int) or angle_subdivision <= 0:
1825            raise TypeError("Angle subdivision must be positive integer.")
1826        if not isinstance(min_legs, int) or min_legs <= 0:
1827            raise TypeError("Minimum legs must be positive integer or 'None'.")
1828        if min_legs is None:
1829            min_legs = 1
1830        if max_legs is not None and (
1831            not isinstance(max_legs, int) or max_legs < min_legs
1832        ):
1833            raise TypeError("Maximum legs must be positive integer or 'None'.")
1834        if max_legs is None:
1835            max_legs = num_qubits
1836        if rng_seed is not None and not isinstance(rng_seed, int):
1837            raise TypeError("RNG seed must be integer or 'None'.")
1838        if parametric is not None:
1839            if isinstance(parametric, str):
1840                s = parametric
1841                parametric = lambda i: AngleVar(f"{s}[{i}]", f"{s}_{i}")
1842        rng = np.random.default_rng(seed=rng_seed)
1843        angle_rng_seed = int(rng.integers(65536))  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
1844        if diagonal:
1845            basis_idxs = np.zeros(num_gadgets, dtype=int)
1846        else:
1847            basis_idxs = rng.integers(2, size=num_gadgets)  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
1848        num_legs = rng.integers(min_legs, max_legs + 1, size=num_gadgets)  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
1849        legs_list: List[npt.NDArray[int]] = [
1850            rng.choice(num_qubits, num_legs[i], replace=False)
1851            for i in range(num_gadgets)
1852        ]
1853        angle_rng = np.random.default_rng(seed=angle_rng_seed)
1854        angles: List[Union[Angle, AngleVar]]
1855        angles = [
1856            int(x) * pi / angle_subdivision
1857            for x in angle_rng.integers(
1858                1, 2 * angle_subdivision, size=num_gadgets  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
1859            )
1860        ]
1861        if parametric is not None:
1862            angles = [parametric(i) for i in range(num_gadgets)]
1863        bases = cast(Sequence[Literal["Z", "X"]], ("Z", "X"))
1864        gadgets: List[PhaseGadget] = [
1865            PhaseGadget(bases[(basis_idx + i) % 2], angle, [int(x) for x in legs])
1866            for i, (basis_idx, angle, legs) in enumerate(
1867                zip(basis_idxs, angles, legs_list)
1868            )
1869        ]
1870        return PhaseCircuit(num_qubits, gadgets)
1871
1872    @staticmethod
1873    def from_qasm(
1874        qasm: Union[str, QASM],
1875        *,
1876        mapping: Union[Sequence[int], Mapping[int, int], None] = None,
1877        allow_classical: bool = True,
1878    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1879        """
1880        Constructs a phase circuit from a QASM program.
1881
1882        An optional mapping from QASM qubits to circuit qubits can be supplied.
1883        """
1884        # pylint: disable = too-many-locals, too-many-branches, too-many-statements
1885        if isinstance(qasm, str):
1886            qasm = QASM.parse(qasm)
1887        if not isinstance(qasm, QASM):
1888            raise TypeError(f"Expected QASM object, found {qasm}")
1889        if not isinstance(allow_classical, bool):
1890            raise TypeError()
1891        qasm_num_qubits = qasm.num_qubits
1892        num_bits = qasm.num_bits
1893        if not allow_classical and num_bits > 0:
1894            raise ValueError(
1895                "Cannot construct from quantum circuits with classical registers."
1896            )
1897        if isinstance(mapping, Sequence):
1898            if len(mapping) < qasm_num_qubits:
1899                raise ValueError(
1900                    f"Expected mapping keys [0,...,{qasm_num_qubits}], "
1901                    f"found {sorted(mapping)} instead."
1902                )
1903            _mapping: Optional[List[int]] = list(mapping)
1904        elif isinstance(mapping, Mapping):
1905            _mapping = []
1906            for i in range(qasm_num_qubits):
1907                if i not in mapping:
1908                    raise ValueError(
1909                        f"Expected mapping keys [0,...,{qasm_num_qubits}], "
1910                        f"found {sorted(mapping.keys())} instead."
1911                    )
1912                _mapping.append(mapping[i])
1913        elif mapping is None:
1914            _mapping = None
1915        else:
1916            raise TypeError(
1917                f"Expected Sequence[int] or Mapping[int, int] or None, "
1918                f"found {type(mapping)} instead."
1919            )
1920        if _mapping is not None and set(_mapping) != set(range(qasm_num_qubits)):
1921            raise ValueError(
1922                f"Expected mapping values [0,...,{qasm_num_qubits}], "
1923                f"found {sorted(_mapping)} instead."
1924            )
1925        gadgets = []
1926        qubits: Dict[str, Tuple[int, ...]] = {}
1927        qubit_idx = 0
1928        for reg in qasm.registers:
1929            if isinstance(reg, QASM.QReg):
1930                qubits[reg.name] = tuple(qubit_idx + i for i in range(reg.size))
1931                qubit_idx += reg.size
1932        if _mapping is not None:
1933            qubits = {
1934                reg: tuple(_mapping[i] for i in reg_qs)
1935                for reg, reg_qs in qubits.items()
1936            }
1937        for statement in qasm:
1938            if isinstance(statement, QASM.Version):
1939                continue
1940            if isinstance(statement, QASM.Comment):
1941                continue
1942            if isinstance(statement, QASM.Include):
1943                continue
1944            if isinstance(statement, QASM.QReg):
1945                continue
1946            if isinstance(statement, QASM.CReg):
1947                continue
1948            if isinstance(statement, QASM.UGate):
1949                params = (statement.theta, statement.phi, statement.lam)
1950                reg_name = statement.qubit.register.name
1951                if statement.qubit.pos is not None:
1952                    ugate_qubits = [qubits[reg_name][statement.qubit.pos]]
1953                else:
1954                    ugate_qubits = list(qubits[reg_name])
1955                for q in ugate_qubits:
1956                    gadgets += _u3(q, *params)
1957                continue
1958            if isinstance(statement, QASM.CXGate):
1959                ctrl_reg_name = statement.control.register.name
1960                trgt_reg_name = statement.target.register.name
1961                ctrl_size = statement.control.size
1962                trgt_size = statement.target.size
1963                ctrl_pos = statement.control.pos
1964                trgt_pos = statement.target.pos
1965                if ctrl_size == 1:
1966                    ctrl_pos = 0
1967                if trgt_size == 1:
1968                    trgt_pos = 0
1969                if ctrl_pos is None and trgt_pos is None:
1970                    qubit_pairs = [
1971                        (qubits[ctrl_reg_name][i], qubits[trgt_reg_name][i])
1972                        for i in range(ctrl_size)
1973                    ]
1974                elif ctrl_pos is not None and trgt_pos is None:
1975                    qubit_pairs = [
1976                        (qubits[ctrl_reg_name][ctrl_pos], qubits[trgt_reg_name][i])
1977                        for i in range(trgt_size)
1978                    ]
1979                elif ctrl_pos is None and trgt_pos is not None:
1980                    qubit_pairs = [
1981                        (qubits[ctrl_reg_name][i], qubits[trgt_reg_name][trgt_pos])
1982                        for i in range(ctrl_size)
1983                    ]
1984                elif ctrl_pos is not None and trgt_pos is not None:
1985                    qubit_pairs = [
1986                        (
1987                            qubits[ctrl_reg_name][ctrl_pos],
1988                            qubits[trgt_reg_name][trgt_pos],
1989                        )
1990                    ]
1991                for c, t in qubit_pairs:
1992                    gadgets += _cx(c, t)
1993                continue
1994            if isinstance(statement, QASM.Gate):
1995                reg_name = [t.register.name for t in statement.targets]
1996                reg_size = [t.register.size for t in statement.targets]
1997                reg_pos = [t.pos for t in statement.targets]
1998                for i in range(len(statement.targets)):
1999                    if reg_size[i] == 1:
2000                        reg_pos[i] = 0
2001                if all(p is not None for p in reg_pos):
2002                    size = 1
2003                    gate_qubits = [
2004                        tuple(
2005                            qubits[name][pos]
2006                            for name, pos in zip(reg_name, cast(Sequence[int], reg_pos))
2007                        )
2008                    ]
2009                elif all(p is None for p in reg_pos):
2010                    size = reg_size[0]
2011                    gate_qubits = [
2012                        tuple(qubits[name][i] for name in reg_name) for i in range(size)
2013                    ]
2014                else:
2015                    raise Exception("This should not happen. Please open a bug report.")
2016                gate_params = statement.params
2017                gate_methods = {
2018                    "i": (_i, 1, 0),
2019                    "x": (_x, 1, 0),
2020                    "y": (_y, 1, 0),
2021                    "z": (_z, 1, 0),
2022                    "h": (_h, 1, 0),
2023                    "s": (_s, 1, 0),
2024                    "t": (_t, 1, 0),
2025                    "rx": (_rx, 1, 1),
2026                    "ry": (_ry, 1, 1),
2027                    "rz": (_rz, 1, 1),
2028                    "u3": (_u3, 1, 3),
2029                    "cx": (_cx, 2, 0),
2030                    "cy": (_cy, 2, 0),
2031                    "cz": (_cz, 2, 0),
2032                    "crx": (_crx, 2, 1),
2033                    "cry": (_cry, 2, 1),
2034                    "crz": (_crz, 2, 1),
2035                    "cu1": (_cu1, 2, 1),
2036                }
2037                for gate_name, gate_args in gate_methods.items():
2038                    if statement.name == gate_name:
2039                        m, num_qubits, num_params = gate_args
2040                        if len(gate_qubits[0]) != num_qubits:
2041                            raise ValueError(
2042                                f"Expected {num_qubits} qubits for {gate_name}, "
2043                                f"found {len(gate_qubits[0])}"
2044                            )
2045                        if len(gate_params) != num_params:
2046                            raise ValueError(
2047                                f"Expected {num_params} angles for {gate_name}, "
2048                                f"found {len(gate_params)}"
2049                            )
2050                        for qs in gate_qubits:
2051                            gadgets += m(*qs, *gate_params)  # type: ignore # TODO: fix this!
2052                        break
2053                continue
2054            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported QASM statement: {statement}")
2055        circ = PhaseCircuit(qasm_num_qubits, gadgets)
2056        return circ
2057

2160        if self is other:
2161            return True
2162        if isinstance(other, PhaseCircuit):
2163            return self._circuit == other
2164        if isinstance(other, PhaseCircuitView):

synthesis_methods = ['naive', 'paritysynth', 'steiner-graysynth']
class PhaseGadget: 
 64class PhaseGadget:
 65    """
 66    Immutable container class for a phase gadget.
 67    """
 68
 69    _qubits: FrozenSet[int]
 70    _basis: Literal["Z", "X"]
 71    _angle: AngleExpr
 72
 73    def __init__(
 74        self, basis: Literal["Z", "X"], angle: AngleExpr, qubits: Collection[int]
 75    ):
 76        if not isinstance(qubits, Collection) or not all(
 77            isinstance(q, int) for q in qubits
 78        ):
 79            raise TypeError(
 80                f"Qubits should be a collection of integers, found {qubits}"
 81            )
 82        if not qubits:
 83            raise ValueError("At least one qubit must be specified.")
 84        if basis not in ("Z", "X"):
 85            raise TypeError("Basis should be 'Z' or 'X'.")
 86        if not isinstance(angle, AngleExpr):
 87            raise TypeError(
 88                f"Angle should be an instance of `AngleExpr`, "
 89                f"found {angle} of type {type(angle)} instead."
 90            )
 91        self._basis = basis
 92        self._angle = angle
 93        self._qubits = frozenset(qubits)
 94
 95    @property
 96    def basis(self) -> Literal["Z", "X"]:
 97        """
 98        Readonly property exposing the basis for this phase gadget.
 99        """
100        return self._basis
101
102    @property
103    def angle(self) -> AngleExpr:
104        """
105        Readonly property exposing the angle for this phase gadget.
106        """
107        return self._angle
108
109    @property
110    def qubits(self) -> FrozenSet[int]:
111        """
112        Readonly property exposing the qubits spanned by this phase gadget.
113        """
114        return self._qubits
115
116    def cx_count(
117        self,
118        topology: Topology,
119        *,
120        mapping: Optional[Union[Sequence[int], Dict[int, int]]] = None,
121    ) -> int:
122        """
123        Returns the CX count for an implementation of this phase gadget
124        on the given topology based on minimum spanning trees (MST).
125
126        The optional `mapping` keyword argument can be used to specify a mapping of
127        logical (circuit) qubits to phyisical (topology) qubits.
128        """
129        if not isinstance(topology, Topology):
130            raise TypeError(f"Expected Topology, found {type(topology)}.")
131        if self.angle.is_zero:
132            return 0
133        # if self._angle.value % 2 == 0:
134        #     return 0
135        if mapping is not None and isinstance(mapping, Sequence):
136            mapping = {i: mapping[i] for i in range(len(mapping))}
137        if mapping is not None:
138            # use the reverse mapping on the topology
139            topology = topology.mapped_fwd({mapping[i]: i for i in mapping})
140        return topology.steiner_tree(self._qubits).size()
141
142    def on_qiskit_circuit(self, topology: Topology, circuit: Any) -> None:
143        """
144        Applies this phase gadget to a given qiskit quantum `circuit`,
145        using the given `topology` to determine a minimum spanning
146        tree implementation of the gadget.
147
148        This method relies on the `qiskit` library being available.
149        Specifically, the `circuit` argument must be of type
150        `qiskit.providers.BaseBackend`.
151        """
152        # pylint: disable = too-many-branches, too-many-locals
153        # TODO: currently uses CX ladder, must change into balanced tree! (same CX count)
154        try:
155            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
156            from qiskit.circuit import QuantumCircuit  # type: ignore
157        except ModuleNotFoundError as e:
158            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'qiskit' library.") from e
159        if not isinstance(circuit, QuantumCircuit):
160            raise TypeError(
161                "Argument 'circuit' must be of type " "`qiskit.circuit.QuantumCircuit`."
162            )
163        if not isinstance(topology, Topology):
164            raise TypeError(f"Expected Topology, found {type(topology)}.")
165        # Build MST data structure:
166        mst = topology.steiner_tree(self._qubits)
167        # Pick the root, q0, of the tree
168        if len(self._qubits) == 1:
169            q0 = next(iter(self._qubits))
170        else:
171            q0 = min(*self._qubits)
172        try:
173            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
174            import networkx as nx
175        except ModuleNotFoundError as _:
176            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'networkx' library.")
177        bitstring = [1 if q in self.qubits else 0 for q in topology.qubits]
178        # Create the CNOT ladder
179        upper_ladder: List[Tuple[int, int]] = []
180        steiner_ladder = []
181        if mst.size():
182            if self.basis == "Z":
183                direction = lambda ctrl, trgt: (ctrl, trgt)
184            else:
185                direction = lambda ctrl, trgt: (trgt, ctrl)
186            for head, tail in reversed(list(nx.bfs_edges(mst, source=q0))):
187                trgt, ctrl = direction(head, tail)
188                if bitstring[head] == 0:
189                    bitstring[head] = (bitstring[ctrl] + bitstring[trgt]) % 2
190                    steiner_ladder.append((trgt, ctrl))
191                upper_ladder.append((ctrl, trgt))
192        cnot_ladder = steiner_ladder + upper_ladder
193        for ctrl, trgt in cnot_ladder:
194            circuit.cx(ctrl, trgt)
195        if self.basis == "Z":
196            circuit.rz(self.angle.to_qiskit, q0)
197        else:
198            circuit.rx(self.angle.to_qiskit, q0)
199        for ctrl, trgt in reversed(cnot_ladder):
200            circuit.cx(ctrl, trgt)
201
202    def print_impl_info(self, topology: Topology) -> None:
203        """
204        Prints information about an implementation of this phase gadget
205        on the given topology based on minimum spanning trees (MST).
206        """
207        if not isinstance(topology, Topology):
208            raise TypeError(f"Expected Topology, found {type(topology)}.")
209        mst = topology.steiner_tree(self._qubits)
210        print(f"MST implementation info for {str(self)}:")
211        print(f"  - Overall CX count for gadget: {mst.size()}")
212        print(f"  - MST edges: {mst.edges()}")
213        print("")
214
215    def __str__(self) -> str:
216        return f"{self.basis}({self.angle}) @ {set(self.qubits)}"
217
218    def __repr__(self) -> str:
219        return f"PhaseGadget({repr(self.basis)}, {self.angle}, {set(self.qubits)})"
220
221    def __hash__(self) -> int:
222        return hash((self.basis, self.angle, self.qubits))
223
224    def __eq__(self, other: Any) -> bool:
225        if self is other:
226            return True
227        if not isinstance(other, PhaseGadget):
228            return NotImplemented
229        return (
230            self.basis == other.basis
231            and self.angle == other.angle
232            and self.qubits == other.qubits
233        )

Immutable container class for a phase gadget.

def cx_count( self, topology: pauliopt.topologies.Topology, *, mapping: Union[Sequence[int], Dict[int, int], NoneType] = None) -> int: 
116    def cx_count(
117        self,
118        topology: Topology,
119        *,
120        mapping: Optional[Union[Sequence[int], Dict[int, int]]] = None,
121    ) -> int:
122        """
123        Returns the CX count for an implementation of this phase gadget
124        on the given topology based on minimum spanning trees (MST).
125
126        The optional `mapping` keyword argument can be used to specify a mapping of
127        logical (circuit) qubits to phyisical (topology) qubits.
128        """
129        if not isinstance(topology, Topology):
130            raise TypeError(f"Expected Topology, found {type(topology)}.")
131        if self.angle.is_zero:
132            return 0
133        # if self._angle.value % 2 == 0:
134        #     return 0
135        if mapping is not None and isinstance(mapping, Sequence):
136            mapping = {i: mapping[i] for i in range(len(mapping))}
137        if mapping is not None:
138            # use the reverse mapping on the topology
139            topology = topology.mapped_fwd({mapping[i]: i for i in mapping})
140        return topology.steiner_tree(self._qubits).size()

Returns the CX count for an implementation of this phase gadget on the given topology based on minimum spanning trees (MST).

The optional mapping keyword argument can be used to specify a mapping of logical (circuit) qubits to phyisical (topology) qubits.

def on_qiskit_circuit(self, topology: pauliopt.topologies.Topology, circuit: Any) -> None: 
142    def on_qiskit_circuit(self, topology: Topology, circuit: Any) -> None:
143        """
144        Applies this phase gadget to a given qiskit quantum `circuit`,
145        using the given `topology` to determine a minimum spanning
146        tree implementation of the gadget.
147
148        This method relies on the `qiskit` library being available.
149        Specifically, the `circuit` argument must be of type
150        `qiskit.providers.BaseBackend`.
151        """
152        # pylint: disable = too-many-branches, too-many-locals
153        # TODO: currently uses CX ladder, must change into balanced tree! (same CX count)
154        try:
155            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
156            from qiskit.circuit import QuantumCircuit  # type: ignore
157        except ModuleNotFoundError as e:
158            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'qiskit' library.") from e
159        if not isinstance(circuit, QuantumCircuit):
160            raise TypeError(
161                "Argument 'circuit' must be of type " "`qiskit.circuit.QuantumCircuit`."
162            )
163        if not isinstance(topology, Topology):
164            raise TypeError(f"Expected Topology, found {type(topology)}.")
165        # Build MST data structure:
166        mst = topology.steiner_tree(self._qubits)
167        # Pick the root, q0, of the tree
168        if len(self._qubits) == 1:
169            q0 = next(iter(self._qubits))
170        else:
171            q0 = min(*self._qubits)
172        try:
173            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
174            import networkx as nx
175        except ModuleNotFoundError as _:
176            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'networkx' library.")
177        bitstring = [1 if q in self.qubits else 0 for q in topology.qubits]
178        # Create the CNOT ladder
179        upper_ladder: List[Tuple[int, int]] = []
180        steiner_ladder = []
181        if mst.size():
182            if self.basis == "Z":
183                direction = lambda ctrl, trgt: (ctrl, trgt)
184            else:
185                direction = lambda ctrl, trgt: (trgt, ctrl)
186            for head, tail in reversed(list(nx.bfs_edges(mst, source=q0))):
187                trgt, ctrl = direction(head, tail)
188                if bitstring[head] == 0:
189                    bitstring[head] = (bitstring[ctrl] + bitstring[trgt]) % 2
190                    steiner_ladder.append((trgt, ctrl))
191                upper_ladder.append((ctrl, trgt))
192        cnot_ladder = steiner_ladder + upper_ladder
193        for ctrl, trgt in cnot_ladder:
194            circuit.cx(ctrl, trgt)
195        if self.basis == "Z":
196            circuit.rz(self.angle.to_qiskit, q0)
197        else:
198            circuit.rx(self.angle.to_qiskit, q0)
199        for ctrl, trgt in reversed(cnot_ladder):
200            circuit.cx(ctrl, trgt)

Applies this phase gadget to a given qiskit quantum circuit, using the given topology to determine a minimum spanning tree implementation of the gadget.
