class PhaseCircuit(typing.Sequence[pauliopt.phase.phase_circuits.PhaseGadget]): 
 399class PhaseCircuit(Sequence[PhaseGadget]):
 400    """
 401    Container class for a circuit of mixed ZX phase gadgets.
 402    """
 403
 404    # pylint: disable = too-many-public-methods
 405
 406    _matrix: Dict[Literal["Z", "X"], npt.NDArray[np.uint8]]
 407    """
 408        For `basis in ("Z", "X")`, the matrix `self._matrix[basis]`
 409        is the binary matrix encoding the qubits spanned by the
 410        `basis` gadgets.
 411    """
 412
 413    _gadget_idxs: Dict[Literal["Z", "X"], List[int]]
 414    """
 415        For `basis in ("Z", "X")`, the list `self._gadget_idxs[basis]`
 416        maps each column index `c` for `self._matrix[basis]` to the
 417        index `self._gadget_idxs[c]` in the global list of gadgets for
 418        this circuit for the `basis` gadget corresponding to column `c`.
 419    """
 420
 421    _gadget_legs_cache: Dict[Literal["Z", "X"], List[Optional[Tuple[int, ...]]]]
 422    """
 423        For `basis in ("Z", "X")`, the matrix `self._matrix[basis]`
 424        is the binary matrix encoding the qubits spanned by the
 425        `basis` gadgets.
 426    """
 427
 428    _num_qubits: int
 429    """
 430        The number of qubits spanned by this circuit.
 431    """
 432
 433    _angles: List[AngleExpr]
 434    """
 435        The global list of angles for the gadgets.
 436        The angle for the `basis` gadget corresponding to column index `c`
 437        of matrix `self._matrix[basis]` is given by:
 438
 439        ```py
 440            self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[basis][c]]
 441        ```
 442    """
 443
 444    _rev_gadget_idxs: List[Tuple[Literal["Z", "X"], int]]
 445    """
 446        Reverse gadget index list: to each global gadget index `idx` it returns
 447        a pair with the gadget basis `basis` and the column index `c` for the gadget
 448        in `self._gadget_idxs[basis]` and `self._matrix[basis]`.
 449    """
 450
 451    def __init__(self, num_qubits: int, gadgets: Sequence[PhaseGadget] = tuple()):
 452        if not isinstance(num_qubits, int) or num_qubits <= 0:
 453            raise TypeError("Number of qubits must be a positive integer.")
 454        if not isinstance(gadgets, Sequence) or not all(
 455            isinstance(g, PhaseGadget) for g in gadgets
 456        ):  # pylint: disable = C0330
 457            raise TypeError("Gadgets should be a sequence of PhaseGadget.")
 458        self._num_qubits = num_qubits
 459        # Fills the lists of original indices and angles for the gadgets:
 460        self._gadget_idxs = {"Z": [], "X": []}
 461        self._angles = []
 462        self._rev_gadget_idxs = []
 463        for i, gadget in enumerate(gadgets):
 464            self._rev_gadget_idxs.append(
 465                (gadget.basis, len(self._gadget_idxs[gadget.basis]))
 466            )
 467            self._gadget_idxs[gadget.basis].append(i)
 468            angle = gadget.angle
 469            if isinstance(angle, Angle):
 470                angle %= 2 * pi
 471            self._angles.append(angle)
 472        self._matrix = {}
 473        self._gadget_legs_cache = {}
 474        for basis in cast(Sequence[Literal["Z", "X"]], ("Z", "X")):
 475            # Create a zero matrix for the basis:
 476            self._matrix[basis] = np.zeros(
 477                shape=(num_qubits, len(self._gadget_idxs[basis])), dtype=np.uint8
 478            )
 479            # Set matrix elements to 1 for all qubits spanned by the gadgets for the basis:
 480            legs_cache: List[Optional[Tuple[int, ...]]] = []
 481            self._gadget_legs_cache[basis] = legs_cache
 482            for i, idx in enumerate(self._gadget_idxs[basis]):
 483                for q in gadgets[idx].qubits:
 484                    if not 0 <= q < num_qubits:
 485                        msg = f"Qubit {q} for gadget #{idx} out of bounds ({num_qubits = })"
 486                        raise IndexError(msg)
 487                    self._matrix[basis][q, i] = 1
 488                legs_cache.append(tuple(sorted(gadgets[idx].qubits)))
 489
 490    @property
 491    def num_qubits(self) -> int:
 492        """
 493        Readonly property exposing the number of qubits spanned by this phase circuit.
 494        """
 495        return self._num_qubits
 496
 497    @property
 498    def num_gadgets(self) -> int:
 499        """
 500        Readonly property exposing the number of phase gadgets in the circuit.
 501        """
 502        return len(self._angles)
 503
 504    @property
 505    def gadgets(self) -> Sequence[PhaseGadget]:
 506        """
 507        Readonly property returning the sequence of phase gadgets in this
 508        phase circuit, in order from first to last.
 509
 510        This collection is freshly generated at every call.
 511        """
 512        return tuple(self._iter_gadgets())
 513
 514    @property
 515    def as_readonly(self) -> "PhaseCircuitView":
 516        """
 517        Returns a readonly view on this circuit.
 518        """
 519        return PhaseCircuitView(self)
 520
 521    def set_angles(self, angles: Sequence[AngleExpr]) -> None:
 522        """
 523        Sets all angles for this circuit.
 524        """
 525        if not isinstance(angles, Sequence):
 526            raise TypeError(f"Expected Sequence[AngleExpr], found {type(angles)}.")
 527        for angle in angles:
 528            if not isinstance(angle, AngleExpr):
 529                raise TypeError(f"Expected AngleExpr, found {type(angle)}")
 530        if len(angles) != len(self._angles):
 531            raise ValueError(
 532                f"Expected {len(self._angles)} angles, " f"found {len(angles)} instead."
 533            )
 534        pi2 = 2 * pi
 535        self._angles = [
 536            angle % pi2 if isinstance(angle, Angle) else angle for angle in angles
 537        ]
 538
 539    def refresh_angle_vars(self, params: Union[str, Callable[[int], AngleVar]]) -> None:
 540        if isinstance(params, str):
 541            params = lambda i: AngleVar(f"{params}[{i}]", f"{params}_{i}")
 542        new_angles = [
 543            angle if isinstance(angle, Angle) else params(i)
 544            for i, angle in enumerate(self._angles)
 545        ]
 546        self.set_angles(new_angles)
 547
 548    def rx(self, qubit: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 549        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit X rotation."""
 550        if not isinstance(qubit, int) or not 0 <= qubit < self.num_qubits:
 551            raise TypeError(f"Invalid qubit {qubit}")
 552        self >>= X(angle) @ {qubit}
 553        return self
 554
 555    def rz(self, qubit: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 556        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Z rotation."""
 557        if not isinstance(qubit, int) or not 0 <= qubit < self.num_qubits:
 558            raise TypeError(f"Invalid qubit {qubit}")
 559        self >>= Z(angle) @ {qubit}
 560        return self
 561
 562    def ry(self, qubit: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 563        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Y rotation."""
 564        self.rx(qubit, +pi / 2)
 565        self.rz(qubit, angle)
 566        self.rx(qubit, -pi / 2)
 567        return self
 568
 569    def i(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 570        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit I gate."""
 571        return self
 572
 573    def x(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 574        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit X gate."""
 575        self.rx(qubit, pi)
 576        return self
 577
 578    def z(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 579        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit X gate."""
 580        self.rz(qubit, pi)
 581        return self
 582
 583    def y(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 584        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Y gate."""
 585        self.z(qubit)
 586        self.x(qubit)
 587        return self
 588
 589    def s(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 590        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit S gate."""
 591        self.rz(qubit, pi / 2)
 592        return self
 593
 594    def sdg(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 595        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Sdg gate."""
 596        self.rz(qubit, -pi / 2)
 597        return self
 598
 599    def v(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 600        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit S gate."""
 601        self.rx(qubit, pi / 2)
 602        return self
 603
 604    def vdg(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 605        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Sdg gate."""
 606        self.rx(qubit, -pi / 2)
 607        return self
 608
 609    def t(self, qubit: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 610        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit T gate."""
 611        self.rz(qubit, pi / 4)
 612        return self
 613
 614    def h(
 615        self, qubit: int, basis: Literal["Z", "X"] = "Z", sign: Literal[1, -1] = 1
 616    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 617        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Hadamard gate."""
 618        if basis not in ("Z", "X"):
 619            raise TypeError(f"Invalid basis {basis}.")
 620        if sign not in (1, -1):
 621            raise TypeError(f"Invalid sign {sign}.")
 622        if basis == "Z":
 623            self.rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 624            self.rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 625            self.rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 626        else:
 627            self.rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 628            self.rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 629            self.rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
 630        return self
 631
 632    def cu1(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 633        """Phase gadget implementation of CU1 gate."""
 634        self.add_gadget(Z(-angle) @ {ctrl, tgt})
 635        self.rz(ctrl, angle)
 636        self.rz(tgt, angle)
 637        return self
 638
 639    def crz(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 640        """Phase gadget implementation of CRZ gate."""
 641        self.add_gadget(Z(-angle / 2) @ {ctrl, tgt})
 642        self.rz(tgt, angle / 2)
 643        return self
 644
 645    def cry(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 646        """Phase gadget implementation of CRY gate."""
 647        self.v(tgt)
 648        self.crz(ctrl, tgt, angle)
 649        self.vdg(tgt)
 650        return self
 651
 652    def crx(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: Angle) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 653        """Phase gadget implementation of CRX gate."""
 654        self.h(tgt)
 655        self.crz(ctrl, tgt, angle)
 656        self.h(tgt, sign=-1)
 657        return self
 658
 659    def cz(self, leg1: int, leg2: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 660        """Phase gadget implementation of CZ gate."""
 661        self.cu1(leg1, leg2, pi / 2)
 662        return self
 663
 664    def cy(self, leg1: int, leg2: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 665        """Phase gadget implementation of CY gate."""
 666        self.v(leg1)
 667        self.cz(leg1, leg2)
 668        self.vdg(leg2)
 669        return self
 670
 671    def cx(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 672        """Phase gadget implementation of CX gate."""
 673        self.h(tgt)
 674        self.cz(ctrl, tgt)
 675        self.h(tgt, sign=-1)
 676        return self
 677
 678    def u3(
 679        self, qubit: int, theta: AngleExpr, phi: AngleExpr, lam: AngleExpr
 680    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 681        """Phase gadget implementation of U3 gate."""
 682        self.rz(qubit, lam)
 683        self.ry(qubit, theta)
 684        self.rz(qubit, phi)
 685        return self
 686
 687    def ccz(self, leg1: int, leg2: int, leg3: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 688        """Phase gadget implementation of CCZ gate."""
 689        for bit in (leg1, leg2, leg3):
 690            self.rz(bit, pi / 4)
 691        for src, tgt in ((leg1, leg2), (leg2, leg3), (leg3, leg1)):
 692            self.add_gadget(Z(-pi / 4) @ {src, tgt})
 693        self.add_gadget(Z(pi / 4) @ (leg1, leg2, leg3))
 694        return self
 695
 696    def ccy(self, leg1: int, leg2: int, leg3: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 697        """Phase gadget implementation of CCX gate."""
 698        self.v(leg3)
 699        self.ccz(leg1, leg2, leg3)
 700        self.vdg(leg3)
 701        return self
 702
 703    def ccx(self, leg1: int, leg2: int, leg3: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 704        """Phase gadget implementation of CCX gate."""
 705        self.h(leg3)
 706        self.ccz(leg1, leg2, leg3)
 707        self.h(leg3, sign=-1)
 708        return self
 709
 710    def add_gadget(self, gadget: PhaseGadget) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 711        """
 712        Adds a phase gadget to the circuit.
 713        This is rather less efficient than passing the gadgets in the constructor,
 714        because the internal numpy arrays have to be copied in the process.
 715
 716        The circuit is modified in-place and then returned, as per the
 717        [fluent interface pattern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fluent_interface).
 718        """
 719        if not isinstance(gadget, PhaseGadget):
 720            raise TypeError(f"Expected PhaseGadget, found {type(gadget)}.")
 721        basis = gadget.basis
 722        gadget_idx = len(self._angles)
 723        new_col: npt.NDArray[np.uint64] = np.zeros(
 724            shape=(self._num_qubits, 1), dtype=np.uint64
 725        )
 726        for q in gadget.qubits:
 727            new_col[q] = 1
 728        self._matrix[basis] = np.append(self._matrix[basis], new_col, axis=1)
 729        self._rev_gadget_idxs.append((basis, len(self._gadget_idxs[gadget.basis])))
 730        self._gadget_idxs[basis].append(gadget_idx)
 731        self._angles.append(gadget.angle)
 732        self._gadget_legs_cache[basis].append(tuple(sorted(gadget.qubits)))
 733        return self
 734
 735    def copy(self):
 736        gadgets = [PhaseGadget(g.basis, g.angle, list(g.qubits)) for g in self.gadgets]
 737        return PhaseCircuit(self.num_qubits, gadgets)
 738
 739    def cx_count(
 740        self,
 741        topology: Topology,
 742        *,
 743        mapping: Optional[Union[Sequence[int], Dict[int, int]]] = None,
 744        method: Literal["naive", "paritysynth", "steiner-graysynth"] = "naive",
 745    ) -> int:
 746        """
 747            Returns the CX count for an implementation of this phase gadget
 748            on the given topology based on minimum spanning trees (MST).
 749
 750            The optional `mapping` keyword argument can be used to specify a mapping of
 751            logical (circuit) qubits to phyisical (topology) qubits.
 752
 753        Args:
 754            topology (Topology): Target device topology
 755            mapping (Optional[Union[Sequence[int], Dict[int, int]]], optional): Used qubit mapping. Defaults to None.
 756            method (Literal["naive", "paritysynth", "steiner", optional): Synthesis method. Defaults to "naive".
 757
 758        Raises:
 759            TypeError: If topology is not a Topology and if mapping is not a permutation of range(self.num_qubits).
 760
 761        Returns:
 762            int: The CX count.
 763        """
 764        if not isinstance(topology, Topology):
 765            raise TypeError(f"Expected Topology, found {type(topology)}.")
 766        if mapping is not None and len(mapping) != self.num_qubits:
 767            raise TypeError(
 768                f"Expected {self.num_qubits} mapping entries, " f"found {len(mapping)}"
 769            )
 770        if mapping is not None and isinstance(mapping, Sequence):
 771            mapping = {i: mapping[i] for i in range(len(mapping))}
 772        if mapping is not None and set(mapping.values()) != set(range(self.num_qubits)):
 773            raise TypeError(
 774                f"Expected mapping images [0, ..., {self.num_qubits-1}], "
 775                f"found {sorted(set(mapping.values()))}"
 776            )
 777        if mapping is not None:
 778            # use the reverse mapping on the topology
 779            topology = topology.mapped_fwd({mapping[i]: i for i in mapping})
 780
 781        if method != "naive":
 782            circuit = self.to_qiskit(topology, True, method)
 783            ops = circuit.count_ops()
 784            return ops.get("cx", 0)
 785        return self._cx_count(topology, {})
 786
 787    def mapped(
 788        self, mapping: Union[Sequence[int], Mapping[int, int]]
 789    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 790        """
 791        Returns a new phase circuit with the same gadgets but having
 792        qubits remapped according to the given mapping.
 793        """
 794        if isinstance(mapping, Sequence):
 795            if len(mapping) < self.num_qubits:
 796                raise ValueError(
 797                    f"Expected mapping keys [0,...,{self._num_qubits}], "
 798                    f"found {sorted(mapping)} instead."
 799                )
 800            _mapping = list(mapping)
 801        elif isinstance(mapping, Mapping):
 802            _mapping = []
 803            for i in range(self._num_qubits):
 804                if i not in mapping:
 805                    raise ValueError(
 806                        f"Expected mapping keys [0,...,{self._num_qubits}], "
 807                        f"found {sorted(mapping.keys())} instead."
 808                    )
 809                _mapping.append(mapping[i])
 810        else:
 811            raise TypeError(
 812                f"Expected Sequence[int] or Mapping[int, int], "
 813                f"found {type(mapping)} instead."
 814            )
 815        if set(_mapping) != set(range(self._num_qubits)):
 816            raise ValueError(
 817                f"Expected mapping values [0,...,{self._num_qubits}], "
 818                f"found {sorted(_mapping)} instead."
 819            )
 820        remapped_gadgets = [
 821            PhaseGadget(g.basis, g.angle, [_mapping[q] for q in g.qubits])
 822            for g in self.gadgets
 823        ]
 824        return PhaseCircuit(self._num_qubits, remapped_gadgets)
 825
 826    def color_flip(self) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 827        """
 828        Returns a new phase circuit with the same gadgets but having
 829        all basis switched from Z to X and vice versa.
 830        """
 831        flipped_gadgets = [
 832            PhaseGadget("X" if g.basis == "Z" else "Z", g.angle, g.qubits)
 833            for g in self.gadgets
 834        ]
 835        return PhaseCircuit(self._num_qubits, flipped_gadgets)
 836
 837    def dagger(self) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 838        """
 839        Returns a new phase circuit with the same gadgets but having
 840        all angles negated.
 841        """
 842        inverted_gadgets = [
 843            PhaseGadget(g.basis, -g.angle, g.qubits) for g in reversed(self.gadgets)
 844        ]
 845        return PhaseCircuit(self._num_qubits, inverted_gadgets)
 846
 847    def normalize(self) -> "PhaseCircuit":
 848        """Fuse and reorder gadgets of the same basis."""
 849        d = OrderedDict()
 850        basis = None
 851        circ = PhaseCircuit(self._num_qubits)
 852        for g in self.gadgets:
 853            if g.basis != basis:
 854                for legs, angle in d.items():
 855                    circ >>= PhaseGadget(basis, angle, legs)
 856                basis = g.basis
 857            else:
 858                if g.qubits not in d:
 859                    d[g.qubits] = 0
 860                d[g.qubits] += g.angle
 861        for legs, angle in d.items():
 862            circ >>= PhaseGadget(basis, angle, legs)
 863
 864        return circ
 865
 866    def to_qiskit(
 867        self,
 868        topology: Topology,
 869        simplified: bool = True,
 870        method: Literal["naive", "paritysynth", "steiner-graysynth"] = "naive",
 871        cx_synth: Literal["permrowcol", "naive"] = "naive",
 872        return_cx: bool = False,
 873        reallocate: bool = False,
 874    ) -> Any:
 875        """Generates a qiskit QuantumCircuit equivalent to this PhaseCircuit.
 876
 877        Args:
 878            topology (Topology): Target device topology
 879            simplified (bool, optional): Simplifiy the PhaseCircuit before synthesis. Defaults to True.
 880            method (Literal["naive", "paritysynth", "steiner", optional): Which method of synthesis should be used. Defaults to "naive".
 881            cx_synth (Literal["permrowcol", "naive"], optional): Which method should be used for synthesizing the final CXCircuit. Defaults to "naive".
 882            return_cx (bool, optional): Whether to return the final CXCircuit separately without synthesizing it. Defaults to False.
 883            reallocate (bool, optional): Whether qubit reallocation is allowed when synthesizing the final CXCircuit. Defaults to False.
 884
 885        Raises:
 886            ModuleNotFoundError: Requires Qiskit to be installed
 887
 888        Returns:
 889            qiskit.QuantumCircuit: The synthesized equivalent circuit
 890            CXCircuit (optional): The final CNOTs of the circuit not yet concatinated to the qiskit circuit.
 891        """
 892        try:
 893            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
 894            from qiskit.circuit import QuantumCircuit
 895        except ModuleNotFoundError as e:
 896            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'qiskit' library.") from e
 897        if simplified:
 898            phase_circuit = self.simplified()
 899        else:
 900            phase_circuit = self.cloned()
 901        if method == "naive":
 902            cxs = CXCircuit(topology)
 903            gates = phase_circuit.gadgets
 904        elif method == "paritysynth":
 905            gates, cxs = phase_circuit._paritysynth(topology)
 906        elif method == "steiner-graysynth":
 907            gates, cxs = phase_circuit._steiner_graysynth(topology)
 908        circuit = QuantumCircuit(self.num_qubits)
 909        for gate in gates:
 910            if isinstance(gate, PhaseGadget):
 911                gate.on_qiskit_circuit(topology, circuit)
 912            else:
 913                circuit.cx(*gate)
 914        if cx_synth != "naive":
 915            cxs = CXCircuit.from_parity_matrix(
 916                cxs.parity_matrix(), topology, method=cx_synth, reallocate=reallocate
 917            )
 918        if return_cx:
 919            return circuit, cxs
 920        new_cxs = cxs.to_qiskit(method="naive")
 921        circuit.compose(new_cxs, inplace=True)
 922        circuit.metadata = {"final_layout": new_cxs.metadata["final_layout"]}
 923        return circuit
 924
 925    def _paritysynth(
 926        self, topology: Topology
 927    ) -> Tuple[List[Union[PhaseGadget, Tuple[int, int]]], CXCircuit]:
 928        """Function generating a sequence of CNOTs and single qubit PhaseGadgets representing this PhaseCircuit.
 929        For synthesis, the method from [1] is used.
 930
 931        [1] Vandaele, Vivien, Simon Martiel, and Timothe Goubault de Brugire. "Phase polynomials synthesis algorithms for NISQ architectures and beyond." Quantum Science and Technology 7.4 (2022): 045027.
 932        https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/2058-9565/ac5a0e/pdf?casa_token=wC-rL5mT7eUAAAAA:tlE5CNn64TQR-Xp8eqPxlQEJyjUSUn1jF6Z6pApyJa9DPZKeYvFAnthRuWNnpS1vvz11oLtH0HPG
 933
 934        Args:
 935            topology (Topology): Topology representing the target quantum computer
 936
 937        Raises:
 938            ModuleNotFoundError: Networkx is required to run this.
 939
 940        Returns:
 941            List[Union[PhaseGadget, Tuple[int, int]]]: A list containing single qubit phase gadgets and tuples representing CNOT(ctrl, trgt)
 942            CXCircuit: A CXCircuit containing the cnots to make the linear function of cnots that are optimized out of the phase gadgets.
 943        """
 944        try:
 945            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
 946            import networkx as nx
 947        except ModuleNotFoundError as _:
 948            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'networkx' library.")
 949        blocks = []
 950        block = []
 951        if len(self.gadgets) == 0:
 952            return [], CXCircuit(topology, [])
 953        basis = self._rev_gadget_idxs[0][0]
 954        for b, idx in self._rev_gadget_idxs:
 955            if b == basis:
 956                block.append(idx)
 957            else:
 958                blocks.append((basis, block))
 959                block = [idx]
 960                basis = b
 961        if len(block) > 0:
 962            blocks.append((basis, block))
 963        if len(blocks) == 0:
 964            return [], CXCircuit(topology)
 965        gates = []
 966        CX_aggregate = []
 967
 968        def pick_root(mst, matrix_dict, direction):
 969            best_root, best_score = None, None
 970            for root in mst.nodes:
 971                ladder = []
 972                x_matrix = matrix_dict["X"].copy()
 973                z_matrix = matrix_dict["Z"].copy()
 974                for head, tail in reversed(
 975                    list(nx.bfs_edges(mst, source=root))
 976                ):  # trgt, ctrl
 977                    trgt, ctrl = direction(head, tail)
 978                    ladder.append((ctrl, trgt))
 979                    x_matrix[trgt] ^= x_matrix[ctrl]
 980                    z_matrix[ctrl] ^= z_matrix[trgt]
 981                score = np.sum(x_matrix) + np.sum(
 982                    z_matrix
 983                )  # The orignal paper wanted argmin(sort()) which is ill-defined. I took the liberty to use h(P^X) instead
 984                if not best_score or best_score > score:
 985                    best_root, best_score = root, score
 986            return best_root
 987
 988        def idx2terminals(idx, basis):
 989            return [
 990                q
 991                for q in range(topology.num_qubits)
 992                if self._matrix[basis][q, idx] == 1
 993            ]
 994
 995        for current_basis, block in blocks:
 996            if current_basis == "Z":
 997                direction = lambda ctrl, trgt: (ctrl, trgt)
 998            else:
 999                direction = lambda ctrl, trgt: (trgt, ctrl)
1000            while len(block) > 0:
1001                # Pick the cheapest gadget
1002                sizes = [
1003                    topology.steiner_tree(idx2terminals(i, current_basis)).size()
1004                    for i in block
1005                ]
1006                index = block[np.argmin(sizes)]
1007                terminals = idx2terminals(index, current_basis)
1008                if len(terminals) > 1:
1009                    # Get the CX ladder for the gaddget
1010                    mst = topology.steiner_tree(terminals)
1011                    for head, tail in reversed(
1012                        list(nx.bfs_edges(mst, source=terminals[0]))
1013                    ):  # Use bfs to help CX depth
1014                        ctrl, trgt = direction(head, tail)
1015                        bitstring = self._matrix[current_basis][:, index]
1016                        if bitstring[head] == 0:
1017                            self.conj_by_cx(ctrl, trgt)
1018                            gates.append((ctrl, trgt))
1019                            CX_aggregate.append((ctrl, trgt))
1020
1021                    remaining_X_idxs = [
1022                        i for basis, bl in blocks for i in bl if basis == "X"
1023                    ]
1024                    remaining_Z_idxs = [
1025                        i for basis, bl in blocks for i in bl if basis == "Z"
1026                    ]
1027                    remaining_gadgets = {
1028                        "X": self._matrix["X"][:, remaining_X_idxs],
1029                        "Z": self._matrix["Z"][:, remaining_Z_idxs],
1030                    }
1031                    root = pick_root(mst, remaining_gadgets, direction)
1032                    for head, tail in reversed(
1033                        list(nx.bfs_edges(mst, source=root))
1034                    ):  # trgt, ctrl
1035                        trgt, ctrl = direction(head, tail)
1036                        self.conj_by_cx(ctrl, trgt)
1037                        gates.append((ctrl, trgt))
1038                        CX_aggregate.append((ctrl, trgt))
1039                else:
1040                    # The chosen gadget is trivial
1041                    root = terminals[0]
1042                gates.append(
1043                    PhaseGadget(
1044                        current_basis,
1045                        self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[current_basis][index]],
1046                        [root],
1047                    )
1048                )
1049                # Sanity check:
1050                assert (
1051                    np.sum(self._matrix[current_basis][:, index]) == 1
1052                ), "The chosen gadget was not properly reduced and cannot be removed."
1053                # Remove that parity from the matrix
1054                block.remove(index)
1055
1056        cnots_circuit = CXCircuit(
1057            topology,
1058            [CXCircuitLayer(topology, [cnot]) for cnot in reversed(CX_aggregate)],
1059        )
1060        return gates, cnots_circuit
1061
1062    def _steiner_graysynth(
1063        self, topology: Topology
1064    ) -> Tuple[List[Union[PhaseGadget, Tuple[int, int]]], CXCircuit]:
1065        """Function generating a sequence of CNOTs and single qubit PhaseGadgets representing this PhaseCircuit.
1066        For synthesis, the method from [1] is used.
1067
1068        [1] Meijer - van de Griend, Arianne, and Ross Duncan. "Architecture-aware synthesis of phase polynomials for NISQ devices." arXiv preprint arXiv:2004.06052 (2020).
1069        https://arxiv.org/pdf/2004.06052.pdf
1070
1071        Args:
1072            topology (Topology): Topology representing the target quantum computer
1073
1074        Raises:
1075            ModuleNotFoundError: Networkx is required to run this.
1076
1077        Returns:
1078            List[Union[PhaseGadget, Tuple[int, int]]]: A list containing single qubit phase gadgets and tuples representing CNOT(ctrl, trgt)
1079            CXCircuit: A CXCircuit containing the cnots to make the linear function of cnots that are optimized out of the phase gadgets.
1080        """
1081        try:
1082            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
1083            import networkx as nx
1084        except ModuleNotFoundError as _:
1085            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'networkx' library.")
1086
1087        blocks = []
1088        block = []
1089        if len(self.gadgets) == 0:
1090            return [], CXCircuit(topology, [])
1091        basis = self._rev_gadget_idxs[0][0]
1092        for b, idx in self._rev_gadget_idxs:
1093            if b == basis:
1094                block.append(idx)
1095            else:
1096                blocks.append((basis, block))
1097                block = [idx]
1098                basis = b
1099        if len(block) > 0:
1100            blocks.append((basis, block))
1101        if len(blocks) == 0:
1102            return [], CXCircuit(topology)
1103        gates = []
1104        CX_aggregate = []
1105
1106        def idx2bitstring(idx, basis):
1107            return self._matrix[basis][:, idx]
1108
1109        def place_cnot(ctrl, trgt, basis):
1110            if basis == "Z":
1111                gates.append((ctrl, trgt))
1112                CX_aggregate.append((ctrl, trgt))
1113                self.conj_by_cx(ctrl, trgt)
1114            else:
1115                place_cnot(trgt, ctrl, "Z")
1116
1117        def ones_recursion(gadgets, subgraph, row, basis):
1118            to_remove = []
1119            for g in gadgets:  # Remove trivial gadgets
1120                bitstring = idx2bitstring(g, basis)
1121                if np.sum(bitstring) == 1:
1122                    gates.append(
1123                        PhaseGadget(
1124                            basis,
1125                            self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[basis][g]],
1126                            [
1127                                q
1128                                for q in range(topology.num_qubits)
1129                                if bitstring[q] == 1
1130                            ],
1131                        )
1132                    )
1133                    to_remove.append(g)
1134            [gadgets.remove(g) for g in to_remove]
1135            if gadgets:
1136                neighbors = [q for q in iter(topology.adjacent(row)) if q in subgraph]
1137                n = neighbors[
1138                    np.argmax(
1139                        [
1140                            len([g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[q] == 1])
1141                            for q in neighbors
1142                        ]
1143                    )
1144                ]
1145
1146                if len([g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[n] == 1]) > 0:
1147                    place_cnot(row, n, basis)
1148                    for gadget in gadgets:
1149                        qubits = [
1150                            q for q in subgraph if idx2bitstring(gadget, basis)[q] == 1
1151                        ]
1152                        if len(qubits) == 1:
1153                            gates.append(
1154                                PhaseGadget(
1155                                    basis,
1156                                    self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[basis][gadget]],
1157                                    qubits,
1158                                )
1159                            )
1160                            gadgets.remove(gadget)
1161
1162                else:
1163                    place_cnot(n, row, basis)
1164                    place_cnot(row, n, basis)
1165                zeroes = [g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[row] == 0]
1166                ones = [g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[row] == 1]
1167                zeroes_recursion(zeroes, [i for i in subgraph if i != row], basis)
1168                ones_recursion(ones, [i for i in subgraph], row, basis)
1169
1170        def zeroes_recursion(gadgets, subgraph, basis):
1171            if subgraph and gadgets:
1172                rows = topology.non_cutting_qubits(subgraph)
1173                counts = [
1174                    [
1175                        np.sum(idx2bitstring(g, basis))
1176                        for g in gadgets
1177                        if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[r] == 1
1178                    ]
1179                    for r in rows
1180                ]
1181                row = rows[
1182                    np.argmax(
1183                        [
1184                            np.max(counts[i]) if counts[i] else topology.num_qubits
1185                            for i, r in enumerate(rows)
1186                        ]
1187                    )
1188                ]
1189                zeroes = [g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[row] == 0]
1190                ones = [g for g in gadgets if idx2bitstring(g, basis)[row] == 1]
1191                zeroes_recursion(zeroes, [i for i in subgraph if i != row], basis)
1192                ones_recursion(ones, [i for i in subgraph], row, basis)
1193
1194        for basis, block in blocks:
1195            for i in block:
1196                bitstring = idx2bitstring(i, basis)
1197                if np.sum(bitstring) == 1:
1198                    gates.append(
1199                        PhaseGadget(
1200                            basis,
1201                            self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[basis][i]],
1202                            [
1203                                q
1204                                for q in range(topology.num_qubits)
1205                                if bitstring[q] == 1
1206                            ],
1207                        )
1208                    )
1209                    block.remove(i)
1210            zeroes_recursion(block, [i for i in range(topology.num_qubits)], basis)
1211
1212        cnots_circuit = CXCircuit(
1213            topology,
1214            [CXCircuitLayer(topology, [cnot]) for cnot in reversed(CX_aggregate)],
1215        )
1216        return gates, cnots_circuit
1217
1218    @overload
1219    def to_svg(
1220        self,
1221        *,
1222        zcolor: str = "#CCFFCC",
1223        xcolor: str = "#FF8888",
1224        hscale: float = 1.0,
1225        vscale: float = 1.0,
1226        scale: float = 1.0,
1227        svg_code_only: Literal[True],
1228    ) -> str:
1229        ...
1230
1231    @overload
1232    def to_svg(
1233        self,
1234        *,
1235        zcolor: str = "#CCFFCC",
1236        xcolor: str = "#FF8888",
1237        hscale: float = 1.0,
1238        vscale: float = 1.0,
1239        scale: float = 1.0,
1240        svg_code_only: Literal[False] = False,
1241    ) -> Any:
1242        ...
1243
1244    def to_svg(
1245        self,
1246        *,
1247        zcolor: str = "#CCFFCC",
1248        xcolor: str = "#FF8888",
1249        hscale: float = 1.0,
1250        vscale: float = 1.0,
1251        scale: float = 1.0,
1252        svg_code_only: bool = False,
1253    ) -> Any:
1254        """
1255        Returns an SVG representation of this circuit, using
1256        the ZX calculus to express phase gadgets.
1257
1258        The keyword arguments `zcolor` and `xcolor` can be used to
1259        specify a colour for the Z and X basis spiders in the circuit.
1260        The keyword arguments `hscale` and `vscale` can be used to
1261        scale the circuit representation horizontally and vertically.
1262        The keyword argument `scale` can be used to scale the circuit
1263        representation isotropically.
1264        The keyword argument `svg_code_only` (default `False`) can be used
1265        to specify that the SVG code itself be returned, rather than the
1266        IPython `SVG` object.
1267        """
1268        if not isinstance(zcolor, str):
1269            raise TypeError("Keyword argument 'zcolor' must be string.")
1270        if not isinstance(xcolor, str):
1271            raise TypeError("Keyword argument 'xcolor' must be string.")
1272        if not isinstance(hscale, (int, float)) or hscale <= 0.0:
1273            raise TypeError("Keyword argument 'hscale' must be positive float.")
1274        if not isinstance(vscale, (int, float)) or vscale <= 0.0:
1275            raise TypeError("Keyword argument 'vscale' must be positive float.")
1276        if not isinstance(scale, (int, float)) or scale <= 0.0:
1277            raise TypeError("Keyword argument 'scale' must be positive float.")
1278        return self._to_svg(
1279            zcolor=zcolor,
1280            xcolor=xcolor,
1281            hscale=hscale,
1282            vscale=vscale,
1283            scale=scale,
1284            svg_code_only=svg_code_only,
1285        )  # type: ignore[call-overload]
1286
1287    @overload
1288    def _to_svg(
1289        self,
1290        *,
1291        zcolor: str = "#CCFFCC",
1292        xcolor: str = "#FF8888",
1293        hscale: float = 1.0,
1294        vscale: float = 1.0,
1295        scale: float = 1.0,
1296        svg_code_only: Literal[True],
1297    ) -> str:
1298        ...
1299
1300    @overload
1301    def _to_svg(
1302        self,
1303        *,
1304        zcolor: str = "#CCFFCC",
1305        xcolor: str = "#FF8888",
1306        hscale: float = 1.0,
1307        vscale: float = 1.0,
1308        scale: float = 1.0,
1309        svg_code_only: Literal[False] = False,
1310    ) -> Any:
1311        ...
1312
1313    def _to_svg(
1314        self,
1315        *,
1316        zcolor: str = "#CCFFCC",
1317        xcolor: str = "#FF8888",
1318        hscale: float = 1.0,
1319        vscale: float = 1.0,
1320        scale: float = 1.0,
1321        svg_code_only: bool = False,
1322    ) -> Any:
1323        # pylint: disable = too-many-locals, too-many-statements
1324        # TODO: clean this up, restructure into a separate function, reuse for opt circuit
1325        num_qubits = self._num_qubits
1326        vscale *= scale
1327        hscale *= scale
1328        gadgets = self.gadgets
1329        num_digits = int(ceil(log10(num_qubits)))
1330        line_height = int(ceil(30 * vscale))
1331        row_width = int(ceil(120 * hscale))
1332        pad_x = int(ceil(10 * hscale))
1333        margin_x = int(ceil(40 * hscale))
1334        pad_y = int(ceil(20 * vscale))
1335        r = pad_y // 2 - 2
1336        font_size = 2 * r
1337        pad_x += font_size * (num_digits + 1)
1338        delta_fst = row_width // 4
1339        delta_snd = 2 * row_width // 4
1340        width = 2 * pad_x + 2 * margin_x + row_width * len(gadgets)
1341        height = pad_y + line_height * (num_qubits + 1)
1342        builder = SVGBuilder(width, height)
1343        levels: List[int] = [0 for _ in range(num_qubits)]
1344        max_lvl = 0
1345        for gadget in gadgets:
1346            fill = zcolor if gadget.basis == "Z" else xcolor
1347            other_fill = xcolor if gadget.basis == "Z" else zcolor
1348            qubit_span = range(min(gadget.qubits), max(gadget.qubits) + 1)
1349            lvl = max(levels[q] for q in qubit_span)
1350            max_lvl = max(max_lvl, lvl)
1351            x = pad_x + margin_x + lvl * row_width
1352            for q in qubit_span:
1353                levels[q] = lvl + 1
1354            if len(gadget.qubits) > 1:
1355                text_y = pad_y + min(gadget.qubits) * line_height + line_height // 2
1356                for q in gadget.qubits:
1357                    y = pad_y + (q + 1) * line_height
1358                    builder.line((x, y), (x + delta_fst, text_y))
1359                for q in gadget.qubits:
1360                    y = pad_y + (q + 1) * line_height
1361                    builder.circle((x, y), r, fill)
1362                builder.line((x + delta_fst, text_y), (x + delta_snd, text_y))
1363                builder.circle((x + delta_fst, text_y), r, other_fill)
1364                builder.circle((x + delta_snd, text_y), r, fill)
1365                builder.text(
1366                    (x + delta_snd + 2 * r, text_y),
1367                    str(gadget.angle),
1368                    font_size=font_size,
1369                )
1370            else:
1371                for q in gadget.qubits:
1372                    y = pad_y + (q + 1) * line_height
1373                    builder.circle((x, y), r, fill)
1374                builder.text(
1375                    (x + r, y - line_height // 3),
1376                    str(gadget.angle),
1377                    font_size=font_size,
1378                )
1379        width = 2 * pad_x + 2 * margin_x + row_width * (2 * max_lvl + 1) // 2
1380        _builder = SVGBuilder(width, height)
1381        for q in range(num_qubits):
1382            y = pad_y + (q + 1) * line_height
1383            _builder.line((pad_x, y), (width - pad_x, y))
1384            _builder.text((0, y), f"{str(q):>{num_digits}}", font_size=font_size)
1385            _builder.text(
1386                (width - pad_x + r, y), f"{str(q):>{num_digits}}", font_size=font_size
1387            )
1388        _builder >>= builder
1389        svg_code = repr(_builder)
1390        if svg_code_only:
1391            return svg_code
1392        try:
1393            # pylint: disable = import-outside-toplevel
1394            from IPython.core.display import SVG  # type: ignore
1395        except ModuleNotFoundError as e:
1396            raise ModuleNotFoundError("You must install the 'IPython' library.") from e
1397        return SVG(svg_code)
1398
1399    def cloned(self) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1400        """
1401        Produces an exact copy of this phase circuit.
1402        """
1403        return PhaseCircuit(self._num_qubits, tuple(self._iter_gadgets()))
1404
1405    def conj_by_cx(self, ctrl: int, trgt: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1406        """
1407        Conjugates this circuit by a CX gate with given control/target.
1408        The circuit is modified in-place and then returned, as per the
1409        [fluent interface pattern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fluent_interface).
1410        """
1411        if not 0 <= ctrl < self._num_qubits:
1412            raise ValueError(f"Invalid control qubit {ctrl}.")
1413        if not 0 <= trgt < self._num_qubits:
1414            raise ValueError(f"Invalid target qubit {trgt}.")
1415        self._matrix["Z"][ctrl, :] = (
1416            self._matrix["Z"][ctrl, :] + self._matrix["Z"][trgt, :]
1417        ) % 2
1418        self._matrix["X"][trgt, :] = (
1419            self._matrix["X"][trgt, :] + self._matrix["X"][ctrl, :]
1420        ) % 2
1421        # Update legs caches:
1422        z_gadget_legs_cache = self._gadget_legs_cache["Z"]
1423        for z_gadget_idx in np.where(self._matrix["Z"][trgt, :] == 1)[0]:
1424            z_gadget_legs_cache[z_gadget_idx] = None
1425        x_gadget_legs_cache = self._gadget_legs_cache["X"]
1426        for x_gadget_idx in np.where(self._matrix["X"][ctrl, :] == 1)[0]:
1427            x_gadget_legs_cache[x_gadget_idx] = None
1428        return self

1535    def simplified(self) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1536        """
1537        Returns a new phase circuit which has been simplified using the
1538        commutation and fusion rules for gadgets.
1539        """
1540        # pylint: disable = too-many-locals, too-many-branches, too-many-statements
1541        num_qubits = self.num_qubits
1542        gadgets = [g for g in self.gadgets if not g.angle.is_zero]
1543        # Groups of gadgets of the same basis, fused together where possible
1544        GadgetGroup = Tuple[Literal["Z", "X"], Dict[int, AngleExpr]]
1545        groups: List[GadgetGroup] = [("Z", {})]
1546        # Perform the grouping and fusion
1547        for g in gadgets:
1548            basis, angles = groups[-1]
1549            g_basis = g.basis
1550            g_qubits = _frozenset_to_int(g.qubits)
1551            g_angle = g.angle
1552            # Add the gadget to the current group, or create a new group.
1553            if g_basis == basis:
1554                # Add gadget to current group (fuse if possible)
1555                if g_qubits in angles:
1556                    angles[g_qubits] += g_angle
1557                else:
1558                    angles[g_qubits] = g_angle
1559            else:
1560                # Create a new group (basis has changed)
1561                groups.append((g_basis, {g_qubits: g_angle}))
1562        # The pi gates will be collected separately here
1563        pi_gates = {
1564            "Z": [0 for _ in range(num_qubits)],
1565            "X": [0 for _ in range(num_qubits)],
1566        }
1567        # Perform all commutations, fusions and pi gadget simplifications
1568        # TODO: explain with comments how the jumplist works
1569        # jumplist: Dict[int, Optional[Dict[int, int]]] = {}
1570        for i, (basis, angles) in enumerate(
1571            groups
1572        ):  # pylint: disable = too-many-nested-blocks
1573            # Try commuting all gadgets to the left as much as possible
1574            for qubits, angle in angles.items():
1575                if angle == 0:
1576                    # Skip zeroed gadgets
1577                    continue
1578                # Try to commute the gadget to the left as much as possible
1579                j = i  # j is the current group to which the gadget has been commuted
1580                obstacle_found = False  # this records whether we found an obstacle
1581                while not obstacle_found and j >= 2:
1582                    # if j in jumplist:
1583                    #     j_jump = jumplist[j]
1584                    #     if j_jump is not None and qubits in j_jump:
1585                    #         print("Jump", i, j, j_jump[qubits], bin(qubits))
1586                    #         j = j_jump[qubits]
1587                    #         break
1588                    _, angles_commute = groups[j - 1]  # angles to commute through
1589                    for qubits_commute, angle_commute in angles_commute.items():
1590                        if angle_commute.is_zero:
1591                            # Zero angle gadget, not an obstable
1592                            continue
1593                        # https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9829578/fast-way-of-counting-non-zero-bits-in-positive-integer
1594                        if bin(qubits & qubits_commute).count("1") % 2 != 0:
1595                            # Odd number of shared legs, obstacle found
1596                            obstacle_found = True
1597                            break
1598                    if not obstacle_found:
1599                        # Go to the next group of same basis down the list
1600                        j -= 2
1601                # if i in jumplist and jumplist[i] is not None:
1602                #     jumplist[i][qubits] = j # type: ignore # TODO: do this right
1603                # else:
1604                #     jumplist[i] = {
1605                #         qubits: j
1606                #     }
1607                # Fuse the gadget into the group, and apply pi gate simplification
1608                pi_gadget = False
1609                if j < i:
1610                    # for k in range(j+1, i, 2):
1611                    #     jumplist[k] = None
1612                    # We managed to perform some non-trivial commutation
1613                    angles[qubits] = Angle.zero
1614                    _, angles_fuse = groups[j]
1615                    if qubits in angles_fuse:
1616                        # Fuse with existing gadget on same qubits and same basis
1617                        angles_fuse[qubits] += angle
1618                    else:
1619                        # Add gadget to group
1620                        angles_fuse[qubits] = angle
1621                    if angles_fuse[qubits].is_pi:
1622                        # This is a pi gadget, further simplification to be performed
1623                        angles_fuse[
1624                            qubits
1625                        ] = Angle.zero  # Remove gadget from this group
1626                        pi_gadget = True
1627                elif angle.is_pi:
1628                    # We didn't manage to commute the gadget, but it is a pi gadget
1629                    angles[qubits] = Angle.zero  # Remove gadget from this group
1630                    pi_gadget = True
1631                if pi_gadget:
1632                    # pi gadget
1633                    for k in range(0, j)[::-2]:
1634                        # Commute through gadgets below of other basis, flipping sign if necessary
1635                        _, angles_k = groups[k]
1636                        for qubits_k in angles_k:
1637                            if bin(qubits_k & qubits).count("1") % 2 == 1:
1638                                # Odd number of legs in comon: flip sign
1639                                angles_k[qubits_k] *= -1
1640                    for q in _int_to_iterator(qubits):
1641                        # Break into single-qubit pi gates, recorded separately (at start of circ)
1642                        pi_gates[basis][q] += 1
1643        # Create the new list of gadgets
1644        new_gadgets: List[PhaseGadget] = []
1645        for q in range(num_qubits):
1646            if pi_gates["Z"][q] % 2 == 1:
1647                # Single-qubit pi Z gate
1648                new_gadgets.append(PhaseGadget("Z", pi, {q}))
1649        for q in range(num_qubits):
1650            if pi_gates["X"][q] % 2 == 1:
1651                # Single-qubit pi X gate
1652                new_gadgets.append(PhaseGadget("X", pi, {q}))
1653        for basis, angles in groups:
1654            for qubits, angle in angles.items():
1655                if isinstance(angle, Angle):
1656                    angle = angle % (2 * pi)
1657                if angle != 0:  # skip zero angle gadgets
1658                    new_gadgets.append(
1659                        PhaseGadget(basis, angle, _int_to_frozenset(qubits))
1660                    )
1661        # Return a new phase circuit.
1662        return PhaseCircuit(num_qubits, new_gadgets)
1663
1664    def __eq__(self, other: Any) -> bool:
1665        if self is other:
1666            return True
1667        if not isinstance(other, PhaseCircuit):
1668            return NotImplemented
1669        if self.num_gadgets != other.num_gadgets:
1670            return NotImplemented
1671        if self.num_qubits != other.num_qubits:
1672            return False
1673        return all(g == h for g, h in zip(self._iter_gadgets(), other._iter_gadgets()))
1674
1675    def __irshift__(
1676        self, gadgets: Union[PhaseGadget, "PhaseCircuit", Sequence[PhaseGadget]]
1677    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1678        if isinstance(gadgets, PhaseGadget):
1679            gadgets = [gadgets]
1680        elif isinstance(gadgets, PhaseCircuit):
1681            gadgets = gadgets.gadgets
1682        if not isinstance(gadgets, Sequence) or not all(
1683            isinstance(gadget, PhaseGadget) for gadget in gadgets
1684        ):
1685            raise TypeError(
1686                f"Expected phase gadget or sequence of phase gadgets, found {gadgets}."
1687            )
1688        for gadget in gadgets:
1689            self.add_gadget(gadget)
1690        return self
1691
1692    def __rshift__(
1693        self, gadgets: Union[PhaseGadget, "PhaseCircuit", Sequence[PhaseGadget]]
1694    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1695        circ: PhaseCircuit = PhaseCircuit(self.num_qubits, [])
1696        circ >>= self
1697        circ >>= gadgets
1698        return circ
1699
1700    def _reindex(self, idx: int) -> int:
1701        if 0 <= idx < self.num_gadgets:
1702            return idx
1703        if -self.num_gadgets <= idx < 0:
1704            return idx + self.num_gadgets
1705        raise IndexError(f"Invalid gadget index {idx}")
1706
1707    @overload
1708    def __getitem__(self, idx: int) -> PhaseGadget:
1709        ...
1710
1711    @overload
1712    def __getitem__(self, idx: slice) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1713        ...
1714
1715    def __getitem__(self, idx: Union[int, slice]) -> Union[PhaseGadget, "PhaseCircuit"]:
1716        if isinstance(idx, int):
1717            idx = self._reindex(idx)
1718            basis, col_idx = self._rev_gadget_idxs[idx]
1719            col = self._matrix[basis][:, col_idx]
1720            angle = self._angles[idx]
1721            return PhaseGadget(
1722                basis, angle, {i for i, b in enumerate(col) if b % 2 == 1}
1723            )
1724        if isinstance(idx, slice):
1725            start, stop, step = (idx.start, idx.stop, idx.step)
1726            return PhaseCircuit(
1727                self.num_qubits, list(self._iter_gadgets(start, stop, step))
1728            )
1729        raise TypeError(f"Expected int or slice, found {type(idx)}")
1730
1731    def __len__(self) -> int:
1732        return self.num_gadgets
1733
1734    def _iter_gadgets(
1735        self,
1736        start: Optional[int] = None,
1737        stop: Optional[int] = None,
1738        step: Optional[int] = None,
1739    ) -> Iterator[PhaseGadget]:
1740        if start is None:
1741            start = 0
1742        else:
1743            start = self._reindex(start)
1744        if stop is not None:
1745            stop = self._reindex(stop)
1746        for idx, angle in islice(enumerate(self._angles), start, stop, step):
1747            basis, col_idx = self._rev_gadget_idxs[idx]
1748            col = self._matrix[basis][:, col_idx]
1749            yield PhaseGadget(
1750                basis, angle, {i for i, b in enumerate(col) if b % 2 == 1}
1751            )
1752
1753    def _cx_count(
1754        self, topology: Topology, cache: Dict[int, Dict[Tuple[int, ...], int]]
1755    ) -> int:
1756        """
1757        Returns the CX count for an implementation of this phase circuit
1758        on the given topology based on minimum spanning trees (MST).
1759        """
1760        # pylint: disable = too-many-locals
1761        count = 0
1762        for basis in ("Z", "X"):
1763            basis = cast(Literal["Z", "X"], basis)
1764            gadget_legs_cache = self._gadget_legs_cache[basis]
1765            for j, col in enumerate(self._matrix[basis].T):
1766                angle = self._angles[self._gadget_idxs[basis][j]]
1767                if angle.is_zero_or_pi:
1768                    # Skip zero and pi gadgets
1769                    continue
1770                legs = gadget_legs_cache[j]
1771                if legs is None:
1772                    legs = tuple(int(i) for i in np.where(col == 1)[0])
1773                    gadget_legs_cache[j] = legs
1774                num_legs = len(legs)
1775                if num_legs <= 1:
1776                    # Skip single-qubit gates
1777                    continue
1778                _cache = cache.get(num_legs, None)
1779                if _cache is None:
1780                    _cache = {}
1781                    cache[num_legs] = _cache
1782                legs_count = _cache.get(legs, None)
1783                if legs_count is None:
1784                    legs_count = topology.steiner_tree(legs).size()
1785                    _cache[legs] = legs_count
1786                count += legs_count
1787        return count
1788
1789    def _repr_svg_(self) -> Any:
1790        """
1791        Magic method for IPython/Jupyter pretty-printing.
1792        See https://ipython.readthedocs.io/en/stable/api/generated/IPython.display.html
1793        """
1794        return self._to_svg(svg_code_only=True)
1795
1796    @staticmethod
1797    def random(
1798        num_qubits: int,
1799        num_gadgets: int,
1800        *,
1801        parametric: Union[None, str, Callable[[int], AngleVar]] = None,
1802        angle_subdivision: int = 4,
1803        min_legs: int = 1,
1804        max_legs: Optional[int] = None,
1805        diagonal: bool = False,
1806        rng_seed: Optional[int] = None,
1807    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1808        """
1809        Generates a random circuit of mixed ZX phase gadgets on the given number of qubits,
1810        with the given number of gadgets.
1811
1812        The optional argument `angle_subdivision` (default: 4) can be used to specify the
1813        denominator in the random fractional multiples of pi used as values for the angles.
1814
1815        The optional arguments `min_legs` (default: 1, minimum: 1) and `max_legs`
1816        (default: `None`, minimum `min_legs`) can be used to specify the minimum and maximum
1817        number of legs for the phase gadgets. If `None`, `max_legs` is set to `len(qubits)`.
1818
1819        The optional argument `rng_seed` (default: `None`) is used as seed for the RNG.
1820        """
1821        if not isinstance(num_qubits, int) or num_qubits <= 0:
1822            raise TypeError("Number of qubits must be a positive integer.")
1823        if not isinstance(num_gadgets, int) or num_gadgets < 0:
1824            raise TypeError("Number of gadgets must be non-negative integer.")
1825        if not isinstance(angle_subdivision, int) or angle_subdivision <= 0:
1826            raise TypeError("Angle subdivision must be positive integer.")
1827        if not isinstance(min_legs, int) or min_legs <= 0:
1828            raise TypeError("Minimum legs must be positive integer or 'None'.")
1829        if min_legs is None:
1830            min_legs = 1
1831        if max_legs is not None and (
1832            not isinstance(max_legs, int) or max_legs < min_legs
1833        ):
1834            raise TypeError("Maximum legs must be positive integer or 'None'.")
1835        if max_legs is None:
1836            max_legs = num_qubits
1837        if rng_seed is not None and not isinstance(rng_seed, int):
1838            raise TypeError("RNG seed must be integer or 'None'.")
1839        if parametric is not None:
1840            if isinstance(parametric, str):
1841                s = parametric
1842                parametric = lambda i: AngleVar(f"{s}[{i}]", f"{s}_{i}")
1843        rng = np.random.default_rng(seed=rng_seed)
1844        angle_rng_seed = int(rng.integers(65536))  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
1845        if diagonal:
1846            basis_idxs = np.zeros(num_gadgets, dtype=int)
1847        else:
1848            basis_idxs = rng.integers(2, size=num_gadgets)  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
1849        num_legs = rng.integers(min_legs, max_legs + 1, size=num_gadgets)  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
1850        legs_list: List[npt.NDArray[int]] = [
1851            rng.choice(num_qubits, num_legs[i], replace=False)
1852            for i in range(num_gadgets)
1853        ]
1854        angle_rng = np.random.default_rng(seed=angle_rng_seed)
1855        angles: List[Union[Angle, AngleVar]]
1856        angles = [
1857            int(x) * pi / angle_subdivision
1858            for x in angle_rng.integers(
1859                1, 2 * angle_subdivision, size=num_gadgets  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
1860            )
1861        ]
1862        if parametric is not None:
1863            angles = [parametric(i) for i in range(num_gadgets)]
1864        bases = cast(Sequence[Literal["Z", "X"]], ("Z", "X"))
1865        gadgets: List[PhaseGadget] = [
1866            PhaseGadget(bases[(basis_idx + i) % 2], angle, [int(x) for x in legs])
1867            for i, (basis_idx, angle, legs) in enumerate(
1868                zip(basis_idxs, angles, legs_list)
1869            )
1870        ]
1871        return PhaseCircuit(num_qubits, gadgets)
1872
1873    @staticmethod
1874    def from_qasm(
1875        qasm: Union[str, QASM],
1876        *,
1877        mapping: Union[Sequence[int], Mapping[int, int], None] = None,
1878        allow_classical: bool = True,
1879    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
1880        """
1881        Constructs a phase circuit from a QASM program.
1882
1883        An optional mapping from QASM qubits to circuit qubits can be supplied.
1884        """
1885        # pylint: disable = too-many-locals, too-many-branches, too-many-statements
1886        if isinstance(qasm, str):
1887            qasm = QASM.parse(qasm)
1888        if not isinstance(qasm, QASM):
1889            raise TypeError(f"Expected QASM object, found {qasm}")
1890        if not isinstance(allow_classical, bool):
1891            raise TypeError()
1892        qasm_num_qubits = qasm.num_qubits
1893        num_bits = qasm.num_bits
1894        if not allow_classical and num_bits > 0:
1895            raise ValueError(
1896                "Cannot construct from quantum circuits with classical registers."
1897            )
1898        if isinstance(mapping, Sequence):
1899            if len(mapping) < qasm_num_qubits:
1900                raise ValueError(
1901                    f"Expected mapping keys [0,...,{qasm_num_qubits}], "
1902                    f"found {sorted(mapping)} instead."
1903                )
1904            _mapping: Optional[List[int]] = list(mapping)
1905        elif isinstance(mapping, Mapping):
1906            _mapping = []
1907            for i in range(qasm_num_qubits):
1908                if i not in mapping:
1909                    raise ValueError(
1910                        f"Expected mapping keys [0,...,{qasm_num_qubits}], "
1911                        f"found {sorted(mapping.keys())} instead."
1912                    )
1913                _mapping.append(mapping[i])
1914        elif mapping is None:
1915            _mapping = None
1916        else:
1917            raise TypeError(
1918                f"Expected Sequence[int] or Mapping[int, int] or None, "
1919                f"found {type(mapping)} instead."
1920            )
1921        if _mapping is not None and set(_mapping) != set(range(qasm_num_qubits)):
1922            raise ValueError(
1923                f"Expected mapping values [0,...,{qasm_num_qubits}], "
1924                f"found {sorted(_mapping)} instead."
1925            )
1926        gadgets = []
1927        qubits: Dict[str, Tuple[int, ...]] = {}
1928        qubit_idx = 0
1929        for reg in qasm.registers:
1930            if isinstance(reg, QASM.QReg):
1931                qubits[reg.name] = tuple(qubit_idx + i for i in range(reg.size))
1932                qubit_idx += reg.size
1933        if _mapping is not None:
1934            qubits = {
1935                reg: tuple(_mapping[i] for i in reg_qs)
1936                for reg, reg_qs in qubits.items()
1937            }
1938        for statement in qasm:
1939            if isinstance(statement, QASM.Version):
1940                continue
1941            if isinstance(statement, QASM.Comment):
1942                continue
1943            if isinstance(statement, QASM.Include):
1944                continue
1945            if isinstance(statement, QASM.QReg):
1946                continue
1947            if isinstance(statement, QASM.CReg):
1948                continue
1949            if isinstance(statement, QASM.UGate):
1950                params = (statement.theta, statement.phi, statement.lam)
1951                reg_name = statement.qubit.register.name
1952                if statement.qubit.pos is not None:
1953                    ugate_qubits = [qubits[reg_name][statement.qubit.pos]]
1954                else:
1955                    ugate_qubits = list(qubits[reg_name])
1956                for q in ugate_qubits:
1957                    gadgets += _u3(q, *params)
1958                continue
1959            if isinstance(statement, QASM.CXGate):
1960                ctrl_reg_name = statement.control.register.name
1961                trgt_reg_name = statement.target.register.name
1962                ctrl_size = statement.control.size
1963                trgt_size = statement.target.size
1964                ctrl_pos = statement.control.pos
1965                trgt_pos = statement.target.pos
1966                if ctrl_size == 1:
1967                    ctrl_pos = 0
1968                if trgt_size == 1:
1969                    trgt_pos = 0
1970                if ctrl_pos is None and trgt_pos is None:
1971                    qubit_pairs = [
1972                        (qubits[ctrl_reg_name][i], qubits[trgt_reg_name][i])
1973                        for i in range(ctrl_size)
1974                    ]
1975                elif ctrl_pos is not None and trgt_pos is None:
1976                    qubit_pairs = [
1977                        (qubits[ctrl_reg_name][ctrl_pos], qubits[trgt_reg_name][i])
1978                        for i in range(trgt_size)
1979                    ]
1980                elif ctrl_pos is None and trgt_pos is not None:
1981                    qubit_pairs = [
1982                        (qubits[ctrl_reg_name][i], qubits[trgt_reg_name][trgt_pos])
1983                        for i in range(ctrl_size)
1984                    ]
1985                elif ctrl_pos is not None and trgt_pos is not None:
1986                    qubit_pairs = [
1987                        (
1988                            qubits[ctrl_reg_name][ctrl_pos],
1989                            qubits[trgt_reg_name][trgt_pos],
1990                        )
1991                    ]
1992                for c, t in qubit_pairs:
1993                    gadgets += _cx(c, t)
1994                continue
1995            if isinstance(statement, QASM.Gate):
1996                reg_name = [t.register.name for t in statement.targets]
1997                reg_size = [t.register.size for t in statement.targets]
1998                reg_pos = [t.pos for t in statement.targets]
1999                for i in range(len(statement.targets)):
2000                    if reg_size[i] == 1:
2001                        reg_pos[i] = 0
2002                if all(p is not None for p in reg_pos):
2003                    size = 1
2004                    gate_qubits = [
2005                        tuple(
2006                            qubits[name][pos]
2007                            for name, pos in zip(reg_name, cast(Sequence[int], reg_pos))
2008                        )
2009                    ]
2010                elif all(p is None for p in reg_pos):
2011                    size = reg_size[0]
2012                    gate_qubits = [
2013                        tuple(qubits[name][i] for name in reg_name) for i in range(size)
2014                    ]
2015                else:
2016                    raise Exception("This should not happen. Please open a bug report.")
2017                gate_params = statement.params
2018                gate_methods = {
2019                    "i": (_i, 1, 0),
2020                    "x": (_x, 1, 0),
2021                    "y": (_y, 1, 0),
2022                    "z": (_z, 1, 0),
2023                    "h": (_h, 1, 0),
2024                    "s": (_s, 1, 0),
2025                    "t": (_t, 1, 0),
2026                    "rx": (_rx, 1, 1),
2027                    "ry": (_ry, 1, 1),
2028                    "rz": (_rz, 1, 1),
2029                    "u3": (_u3, 1, 3),
2030                    "cx": (_cx, 2, 0),
2031                    "cy": (_cy, 2, 0),
2032                    "cz": (_cz, 2, 0),
2033                    "crx": (_crx, 2, 1),
2034                    "cry": (_cry, 2, 1),
2035                    "crz": (_crz, 2, 1),
2036                    "cu1": (_cu1, 2, 1),
2037                }
2038                for gate_name, gate_args in gate_methods.items():
2039                    if statement.name == gate_name:
2040                        m, num_qubits, num_params = gate_args
2041                        if len(gate_qubits[0]) != num_qubits:
2042                            raise ValueError(
2043                                f"Expected {num_qubits} qubits for {gate_name}, "
2044                                f"found {len(gate_qubits[0])}"
2045                            )
2046                        if len(gate_params) != num_params:
2047                            raise ValueError(
2048                                f"Expected {num_params} angles for {gate_name}, "
2049                                f"found {len(gate_params)}"
2050                            )
2051                        for qs in gate_qubits:
2052                            gadgets += m(*qs, *gate_params)  # type: ignore # TODO: fix this!
2053                        break
2054                continue
2055            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported QASM statement: {statement}")
2056        circ = PhaseCircuit(qasm_num_qubits, gadgets)
2057        return circ

Container class for a circuit of mixed ZX phase gadgets.

PhaseCircuit( num_qubits: int, gadgets: Sequence[PhaseGadget] = ()) 
451    def __init__(self, num_qubits: int, gadgets: Sequence[PhaseGadget] = tuple()):
452        if not isinstance(num_qubits, int) or num_qubits <= 0:
453            raise TypeError("Number of qubits must be a positive integer.")
454        if not isinstance(gadgets, Sequence) or not all(
455            isinstance(g, PhaseGadget) for g in gadgets
456        ):  # pylint: disable = C0330
457            raise TypeError("Gadgets should be a sequence of PhaseGadget.")
458        self._num_qubits = num_qubits
459        # Fills the lists of original indices and angles for the gadgets:
460        self._gadget_idxs = {"Z": [], "X": []}
461        self._angles = []
462        self._rev_gadget_idxs = []
463        for i, gadget in enumerate(gadgets):
464            self._rev_gadget_idxs.append(
465                (gadget.basis, len(self._gadget_idxs[gadget.basis]))
466            )
467            self._gadget_idxs[gadget.basis].append(i)
468            angle = gadget.angle
469            if isinstance(angle, Angle):
470                angle %= 2 * pi
471            self._angles.append(angle)
472        self._matrix = {}
473        self._gadget_legs_cache = {}
474        for basis in cast(Sequence[Literal["Z", "X"]], ("Z", "X")):
475            # Create a zero matrix for the basis:
476            self._matrix[basis] = np.zeros(
477                shape=(num_qubits, len(self._gadget_idxs[basis])), dtype=np.uint8
478            )
479            # Set matrix elements to 1 for all qubits spanned by the gadgets for the basis:
480            legs_cache: List[Optional[Tuple[int, ...]]] = []
481            self._gadget_legs_cache[basis] = legs_cache
482            for i, idx in enumerate(self._gadget_idxs[basis]):
483                for q in gadgets[idx].qubits:
484                    if not 0 <= q < num_qubits:
485                        msg = f"Qubit {q} for gadget #{idx} out of bounds ({num_qubits = })"
486                        raise IndexError(msg)
487                    self._matrix[basis][q, i] = 1
488                legs_cache.append(tuple(sorted(gadgets[idx].qubits)))

def set_angles(self, angles: Sequence[pauliopt.utils.AngleExpr]) -> None: 
521    def set_angles(self, angles: Sequence[AngleExpr]) -> None:
522        """
523        Sets all angles for this circuit.
524        """
525        if not isinstance(angles, Sequence):
526            raise TypeError(f"Expected Sequence[AngleExpr], found {type(angles)}.")
527        for angle in angles:
528            if not isinstance(angle, AngleExpr):
529                raise TypeError(f"Expected AngleExpr, found {type(angle)}")
530        if len(angles) != len(self._angles):
531            raise ValueError(
532                f"Expected {len(self._angles)} angles, " f"found {len(angles)} instead."
533            )
534        pi2 = 2 * pi
535        self._angles = [
536            angle % pi2 if isinstance(angle, Angle) else angle for angle in angles
537        ]

Sets all angles for this circuit.

def refresh_angle_vars( self, params: Union[str, Callable[[int], pauliopt.utils.AngleVar]]) -> None: 
539    def refresh_angle_vars(self, params: Union[str, Callable[[int], AngleVar]]) -> None:
540        if isinstance(params, str):
541            params = lambda i: AngleVar(f"{params}[{i}]", f"{params}_{i}")
542        new_angles = [
543            angle if isinstance(angle, Angle) else params(i)
544            for i, angle in enumerate(self._angles)
545        ]
546        self.set_angles(new_angles)
def rx( self, qubit: int, angle: pauliopt.utils.AngleExpr) -> PhaseCircuit: 
548    def rx(self, qubit: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
549        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit X rotation."""
550        if not isinstance(qubit, int) or not 0 <= qubit < self.num_qubits:
551            raise TypeError(f"Invalid qubit {qubit}")
552        self >>= X(angle) @ {qubit}
553        return self

Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit X rotation.

558            raise TypeError(f"Invalid qubit {qubit}")

560        return self

def h( self, qubit: int, basis: Literal['Z', 'X'] = 'Z', sign: Literal[1, -1] = 1) -> PhaseCircuit: 
614    def h(
615        self, qubit: int, basis: Literal["Z", "X"] = "Z", sign: Literal[1, -1] = 1
616    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
617        """Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Hadamard gate."""
618        if basis not in ("Z", "X"):
619            raise TypeError(f"Invalid basis {basis}.")
620        if sign not in (1, -1):
621            raise TypeError(f"Invalid sign {sign}.")
622        if basis == "Z":
623            self.rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
624            self.rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
625            self.rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
626        else:
627            self.rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
628            self.rx(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
629            self.rz(qubit, sign * pi / 2)
630        return self

Phase gadget implementation of single-qubit Hadamard gate.

def cu1( self, ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: pauliopt.utils.AngleExpr) -> PhaseCircuit: 
632    def cu1(self, ctrl: int, tgt: int, angle: AngleExpr) -> "PhaseCircuit":
633        """Phase gadget implementation of CU1 gate."""
634        self.add_gadget(Z(-angle) @ {ctrl, tgt})
635        self.rz(ctrl, angle)
636        self.rz(tgt, angle)
637        return self

Phase gadget implementation of CU1 gate.

def u3( self, qubit: int, theta: pauliopt.utils.AngleExpr, phi: pauliopt.utils.AngleExpr, lam: pauliopt.utils.AngleExpr) -> PhaseCircuit: 
678    def u3(
679        self, qubit: int, theta: AngleExpr, phi: AngleExpr, lam: AngleExpr
680    ) -> "PhaseCircuit":
681        """Phase gadget implementation of U3 gate."""
682        self.rz(qubit, lam)

def ccz( self, leg1: int, leg2: int, leg3: int) -> PhaseCircuit: 
687    def ccz(self, leg1: int, leg2: int, leg3: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
688        """Phase gadget implementation of CCZ gate."""
689        for bit in (leg1, leg2, leg3):
690            self.rz(bit, pi / 4)
691        for src, tgt in ((leg1, leg2), (leg2, leg3), (leg3, leg1)):
692            self.add_gadget(Z(-pi / 4) @ {src, tgt})
693        self.add_gadget(Z(pi / 4) @ (leg1, leg2, leg3))
694        return self

Phase gadget implementation of CCZ gate.

def ccy( self, leg1: int, leg2: int, leg3: int) -> PhaseCircuit: 
696    def ccy(self, leg1: int, leg2: int, leg3: int) -> "PhaseCircuit":
697        """Phase gadget implementation of CCX gate."""
698        self.v(leg3)
699        self.ccz(leg1, leg2, leg3)
700        self.vdg(leg3)
701        return self

def add_gadget( self, gadget: PhaseGadget) -> PhaseCircuit: 
710    def add_gadget(self, gadget: PhaseGadget) -> "PhaseCircuit":
711        """
712        Adds a phase gadget to the circuit.
713        This is rather less efficient than passing the gadgets in the constructor,
714        because the internal numpy arrays have to be copied in the process.
715
716        The circuit is modified in-place and then returned, as per the
717        [fluent interface pattern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fluent_interface).
718        """
719        if not isinstance(gadget, PhaseGadget):
720            raise TypeError(f"Expected PhaseGadget, found {type(gadget)}.")
721        basis = gadget.basis
722        gadget_idx = len(self._angles)
723        new_col: npt.NDArray[np.uint64] = np.zeros(
724            shape=(self._num_qubits, 1), dtype=np.uint64
725        )
726        for q in gadget.qubits:
727            new_col[q] = 1
728        self._matrix[basis] = np.append(self._matrix[basis], new_col, axis=1)
729        self._rev_gadget_idxs.append((basis, len(self._gadget_idxs[gadget.basis])))
730        self._gadget_idxs[basis].append(gadget_idx)
731        self._angles.append(gadget.angle)
732        self._gadget_legs_cache[basis].append(tuple(sorted(gadget.qubits)))
733        return self

Adds a phase gadget to the circuit. This is rather less efficient than passing the gadgets in the constructor, because the internal numpy arrays have to be copied in the process.

The circuit is modified in-place and then returned, as per the fluent interface pattern.

def copy(self):
